review_content:
I picked this espresso maker up on Black Friday for $25. I've always liked espresso but usually when I get it in a coffee house or restaurant, it has a certain harshness to it. I always figured it was because the beans they used were old or they weren't packing the grounds properly, resulting in overextraction of parts of it.

So, today I tried making an espresso and latte. I ran water through the machine with no grounds to warm the machine up and see how it worked. Then I added some fine grounds to the 2 cup mark, packing it with a shot glass. Added the water, closed it, and turned it on. Within ~30 seconds I had espresso with a beautiful brown crema. Tasted rich and felt creamy in my mouth. No harshness.

Next, I tried making the latte. I added cold milk and a food thermometer to a small glass, packed the grounds with the bottom of a shot glass, and started it up. Spit out another beautiful espresso and then I turned on the steam function. Got a really frothy milk and stopped it at 150 Fahrenheit. Poured the milk into the espresso and it was heavenly. Had a foam layer on top for those who like to do latte art.

This machine is extremely easy to use. I ran two water-only cycles, an espresso, a latte, and cleaned the machine in under 10 minutes on my first try (never made espresso before at all). That said, always read your instructions. I think a lot of the problems that other reviewers are having are due either to not reading the instructions or just plain 'ole not being very competent with using appliances.

Some tips I can think of:
1) run a water-only cycle to warm the machine up.
2) grind and pack your beans properly. This should be a no-brainer, but will make the difference between just being concentrated coffee, overextracted espresso, and perfect espresso. A good burr grinder will help with this.
3) either buy a tamper or use something other than the flat spoon they provide for tamping. I used a tall shot glass with straight sides. I'm waiting on my tamper to arrive in the mail.
4) use common sense when steaming. This is pressurized steam. It's a lot hotter than boiling water. Though if you manage to burn yourself, you're doing something wrong. It's that simple to use.
5) buy your beans from a roastery. Not only are you supporting a local business, but the beans will be magnitudes fresher and better tasting. If you use beans from the grocery store, they were probably roasted weeks, if not months ago. At my local roasterery, I can buy a bag of beans that's still warm.

Feel free to ask me any questions. I highly recommend the Mr. Coffee ECM160 espresso maker. I made better espresso on my first try with this little guy than the baristas with $1,000 machines at restaurants I've been to. While I'm sure a lot of that is due to poor bean quality, it just shows you what this machine is capable of doing, and at a price considerably cheaper than what you'd expect. I know some folks think that only a pump espresso machine can produce a crema, and maybe the more intense pressure from a pump machine does produce a better crema, but I had no trouble getting one with this steam espresso machine.

review_content:
This is a good little machine, but does require a bit of trial and error, I think, to get a nice cup with froth. I read reviews online which proved very helpful. One tip I followed was to purchase a stainless still pitcher to use with the frother. It was amazing the difference in the amount of froth. That being said, I discovered just using the stainless steel pitcher with a battery operated handheld frother that I already had, also produced amazing froth. So if I had to do over again, I probably would not buy the machine, and just use the handheld frother with the stainless steel pitcher, adding the froth to my coffee. I did not purchase the machine so much for espresso coffee, but for the latte feature. With my regular Mr. Coffee machine, I can make a pot of coffee and let it warm for a couple of hours without tending to it. With this espresso machine, you make a cup or 2 at a time, and drink immediately. But, it does make a nice strong espresso coffee, if that is what you are mostly interested in.
As for delivery, Amazon proved once again to be quick and efficient.

review_content:
Having never made espresso before, my husband and I wanted to get a cheaper espresso machine to practice on before moving on up to a DeLonghi or Nespresso. It's been a good little machine so far, but with more cons than pros.

Pro: fairly simple to use, once you get the hang of it

Cons:
- there's a weird chemically smell during brewing (kind of ruins the experience) that hasn't gone away. It doesn't affect the taste, but the smell is part of the enjoyment that comes with coffee.

- the frother is worse than useless. Anything more than a finger's worth of milk boils over the edge of the container (purchased separately), and what does get streamed is lukewarm at best.

- in the less than two months it's been in use, the plastic lid of the decanter has cracked because of the heat. Mr. Coffee doesn't offer replacement parts, just the full decanter itself, and it's not worth $10 to get a lid that cost them $0.20. Without the lid, espresso splatters everywhere.

It gets the job done, but I am looking forward to being able to purchase a higher quality machine in the future.
title: It's a good machine for beginners

I thought it was because it was new, but by the 7th time using it, it still taste like plastic and just as bad.

review_content:
I'm in love with my coffee again! I had a machine that took those K-cups... you know the one - and I got tired of only taking a few sips of my coffee and wishing it was better. But I kept buying them - different brands - thinking - "if everyone else loves them - why don't I?" Stop conforming and start taking control of your coffee! If you walk in my house - your getting a latte - or an espresso, or something! I love to see my friends faces when they take their first drink... amazement that it was made right there in my kitchen! Now - I have played with it for awhile now and I got the little frothing pitcher and have learned how to get the milk in the pitcher - switch it out for my coffee cup it catch the espresso and then pour the frothed milk in - just like they do in my coffee shops. But you don't have to do that! It's no different in taste - just presentation.

Update: sooooo- One lovely winter morning my daughter and I decided that we are going to make a frappuccino. So of course I turned the Internet to find a recipe. The Pioneer woman has an amazing recipe FYI. But I think I overworked my machine by making all the espresso back to back to back . It didn‚Äôt work correctly the next morning. A Quick Google search gave me the one 800 to Mr. coffee. I thought maybe they would walk me through troubleshooting or some sort of solution that might land me at a repair shop. After a few questions as to what my machine was doing, she came back and asked me for my address and informed me that they would be sending a new machine. And I was to pack up my old machine in the box the new one came in and send it back with the tag that they will provide. Less than a week later ‚Äì new machine. The most amazing part- in the year 2017 - they did not ask for my original receipt or a credit card number to hold the machine. Seriously. This customer service was amazing! Simply the best I‚Äôve dealt with in years!
title: I'm in love with my coffee again
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Do not waste your money.  The metal and plastic seam all along the front (above the red "on" light) came apart.  It overflows if the grind is fine, which should not be a problem because that is what espresso grind is supposed to be.  The milk "frother" works about as good as blowing bubbles with a straw.  The frothing neck is too short and too close to the unit so you can barely fit a small metal frothing cup next to it.  Get a stovetop espresso maker like the Italians use in their homes.  Cheaper but works MUCH better.  Then invest in a Epica Automatic Electric Milk Frother and Heater Carafe.  Best foam EVER!
title: WASTE OF $
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: I've had this for almost 3 weeks, the design is classy and compact and matches my other appliances, the arm for foaming works well. The directions say to clean the machine parts (espresso cup, carafe, steaming arm) thoroughly and run water through the machine before using(the reservoir doesn't come out for cleaning). I ran water through the machine 2x and cleaned all parts before using. I was now sooooo  excited to use my freshly ground espresso in my first DIY latte!!!  Just ew.  It tasted like chemicals, it smelled like a mechanic's workshop and tire rubber.  I ran water through two more times noting that the metal reservoir is what reeked of chemical smells.  2nd espresso just as bitter and chemical tasting.  I ran water through it 10 MORE TIMES  which was very time consuming and still my 3rd espresso attempt tastes like poison. Just ew.  So now, I have an expensive milk steamer that can't make espresso.  So disappointed because I was trying to save money by purchasing this but instead I just wasted more of it!
title: chemical smelling reservoir & toxic tasting espresso for that special frenemy in your life!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
For the price point, this is a great little machine. I bought this machine to learn on and have since moved on to something high quality, but I used this little guy daily for almost 5 months. It's pretty fool proof because of the pressurized baskets, if you tamp finely ground coffee in there you WILL pull espresso. That being said, I found a few things that made a big difference:
1) You HAVE to keep this thing clean. I ran water through the grouphead and wiped it with a towel after every single shot. It gets clogged very easily and you'll see the difference in your extraction. Place a cup underneath the shower head (no portafilter) and run water through it. If you don't see water sprinkling out evenly, and instead see one stream of water coming out, you need to wipe it down.
2) The quality of the actual machinery inside only goes so far, so I found that using a more oily bean produced better crema and shot quality. This is a double-edged sword because an oiler bean will also clog the shower head more easily. But, as stated above, just keep it clean. I didn't have a separate grinder and I found the Starbucks espresso roast, pre-ground (GASP, I know), worked just fine for me.
3) I bought a separate tamper. The best way to gauge how much coffee should be in the basket is with a traditional tamper (the top edge of the tamper should be level with the basket). You can't do this with the little plastic one that comes with it, it's too thin.
4) I can't say much about the steam wand because I was using non-dairy milk the whole time. Never got micro foam with soy milk, but I'm not sure that's the machine's fault, non dairy milk is just tricky to work with. I WILL say that I easily get micro foam with the same milk using the Breville machine I have now.

I loved that this machine had manual extraction. It worked as a great teaching tool, because it forces you to look at the flow rate, color, and consistency of your shot and judge when to stop it. My Breville pulls an automatic shot, which you CAN reprogram, but it's just a bit of a different experience.

Note: I had a tough time priming this machine when I first got it, and initially thought it was DOA. Just the sound of the pump working but no steam being produced. If you experience this, try *firmly* placing the water tank into the machine. After I kind of jammed it in there (after saying, okay, I'll try one more time), a bunch of bubbles escaped and I was able to prime (aka, steam came out).

Overall, this is a wonderful beginner machine and I'd recommend it to anyone!
title: this is a great little machine
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
I bought this machine back in June '17

pros: It makes greats espresso as long as you get the right grind level. I use a manual conical burr grinder that i use for both espresso and french press level grounds so i tend to miss the correct mark from time to time when switching back. it gets good flavor out of the beans.

love the tank on the back, my last espresso maker didn't have one.

love that you don't have to repressurize a chamber to brew the next cup.

cons: the frothing wand isn't very well designed.

it doesn't get as hot as it should when frothing the milk. so when you pour it into the coffee it cools it down to much and then it isn't really hot anymore. which puts it at my personal preferred temp, buy my wife prefers to it be at the proper temp that you would get if you'd gone to a coffee shop so we end up sticking hers in the microwave, which then also hurts the flavor of the coffee itself.

also, you can't use the want with the rubber cover that is supposed to go on it bc at that point all it does is spit water instead of actually aerating the milk to make it frothy. i can get it to froth much better bare. but again, doesn't get it hot enough.

but given the price point of the machine, I didn't expect it to be perfect, but i did hope it to be a little better.

Update - I've had it for ayear now, frothing side no longer works as of yesterday. I cleaned the machine off inthe sink to get all the coffee ground dust and such off it. I can still brew the coffee, but i can no longer get it to switch to the frothing setting. I push the button and i get a small jolt sound from the pump, but then it switches back to the brewing light.. RIP mr Coffee espresso
title: Good for the price point, but still needs some work
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: I bought this as an anniversary present for my wife and less than a year later it leaks out of the spout that shoots hot water into the espresso (Sorry for the non-technical terms). As of last week it has also started producing watery liquid that tastes nothing like the espresso that it originally produced.  Getting a new batch of beans as well as grinding them consistently has not changed the issue.  Currently looking into a replacement and will provide updates on that experience.
title: Wears out within a year.
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
Surprise, still working after 7 months of heavy use. Brews good espresso but oft retains brew in filter making messy refilling. Get the insurance, you will likely use it before expiration. Empty water tank nightly and air dry. Wipe brew nozzle area frequently. Don't overfill filter, place grind about 1/8th inch from top of filter. Clean tray daily. We don't froth, so no comment.

12/29/2016 UPDATE: BUY the INSURANCE: Worked well, multiple cups per day, for 13 months but died quietly after a morning espresso. The insurance required item return but provided return shipping. Once received provided full refund. Yep, I will buy another one + insurance, This lasted longer than I expected and the espresso is good. Expensive machines usually require annual service; this unit is a best buy, for me.
title: Brews good espresso; get the insurance!.
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
I returned this item because I was disappointed in the amount of plastic and the design was annoying. Flavor was decent and I probably could have perfected it with a few more tries, but it wasn't worth it to me for a product I didn't love. Overall, this unit may work for some people, but I didn't love it and three figures is too costly for something I don't love.

Design Flaws:

1) Taller travel-height mugs don't fit;

2) The milk dispenser is made of plastic made to look like metal (would it really have been that costly to use food grade stainless steel here?);

3) The "metal" lever that adjusts the milk dispenser nozzle is also made of cheap plastic, and doesn't feel like it will last;

4) Unit is obnoxiously loud and took multiple cycles for me to get enough milk

5) The milk dispenser nozzle is an accident waiting to happen because it must be pointed towards the mug every time (the mug can't be placed or removed if the nozzle is left in the dispensing position), and I could see myself forgetting to move it if I was tired or trying to multi-task;

6) The milk reservoir is huge, doesn't include markings, and has a plastic lid with a straw that is required for operation -- might be okay if you intend to store the entire reservoir in the fridge, but I wanted a quick pour, steam, wash option.
title: Plastic Overkill and Anything But Simple
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: I use this 3-4 times a day and probably increased sales exponentially having made so many for friends and family. This unit is rock solid and there is no complaints. The quality and speed to squeeze every ounce out of fresh ground beans is exceptional. I did my homework on this puppy and I suppose those that rated it below 3 starts are fools. Next to paying the mega bucks fro a commercial unit, this is as close as you can get to going to Starbucks as you ever will. Easy to use. My only comment is not to pack the grounds too tight. Just enough to form a smooth surface will do the trick. I packed it pretty hard the first few times and it sounded like my grandfather trying to pee you guys know what I mean.! Best investment I have made on Amazon!
title: Holy Crap this is an AMAZING unit!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
Amazing coffee machine. I was skeptical at first about the machine but I actually really love it. The milk reservoir prevents waste of unused steamed milk, it is super easy to attach and detach. I also love the different settings for espresso/cappuccino/latte. Another thing I love is that if my kids want hot cocoa I can easily just steam them milk to have a coffee house style hot cocoa, way better than just making it with hot water.
The machine is a little loud but I don't mind at all because I know that it is making an amazing cup of coffee. It heats up fast which is also great since some mornings I am running out the door in a hurry and don't have a bunch of time to wait while the machine heats up.

There are a few things I would change if I could: First one being that there was an indicator light letting you know when the water reservoir is low and needs to be filled. I have it stilling under a shelf on my counter so it is hard to see the water level and often times I forget to check until it has started making the espresso. Another thing I wish was different was that it could fit a to-go tumbler. We always drink coffee from those since the coffee stays hot longer and there is no way to make them fit. Instead I have to make the coffee in a mug and transfer it to the tumbler. These two things are minor and not deal breakers for me.

One last comment: ALWAYS remember to aim the steamer spout into the cup or mug. It makes a huge mess if you forget and ,eave it pointing down. I only did this once and will never do it again!
title: Amazing coffee machine
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: This is basically a filter coffee machine and not a espressos machine!  But I guess for the price you pay, that's what you'll get!!!
title: not a espresso machine!

Terrible strong burning plastic smell and taste. I bought this for my husband for Christmas and I don't even know if I can return it without the packaging but he can't stand the toxic smell and taste of the coffee and neither can I. He said he'd rather spend more for a product which they didn't use such horrible plastic in the product and aluminum instead of stainless steel in the reservoir. I don't know how there can even be positive reviews on this product unless they are using different materials or different processes in their manufacturing and the quality control is not consistent. I'm concerned that it's a terrible health hazard, considering plastics are known hormone disruptors which cause a multitude of health problems.

I'm not even going to bother with this company ever again. Very disappointed.

review_content:
This is my first espresso machine. I don't have any real problems with it, so maybe it should be 5 stars, but it's a smidgen more messy than I would like (that might be all espresso machines though). It keeps dripping after it's done, so you either have to wait and let it drip into the reservoir or take it off quickly and try to get it to a sink before it drips on your floor/counter.

Also, I think I secretly hoped that if I used starbucks espresso grounds and starbucks vanilla syrup, it would taste exactly like a starbucks vanilla latte, but that's not the case. It's still good, but just not fantastic.

Other than those two things, I like it a lot.
title: Pretty darn good

review_content: people giving this a bad review should really watch a youtube video on how to make espresso. it's not magic. for magic, pay more. this is a great machine. seriously. watch a 2 minute video.

review_content: I ordered this espresso machine bc my husband and i were spending alot of money at starbucks and i was trying to save some $$$.  When we first got it, it was easy to use and the directions were clear.  it is a very basic espresso machine.  The steamer worked great- it just took a few minutes to heat up the 20 oz of milk-- but i like my coffee very hot.  the machine is easy to clean and doesnt take up much space on my countertop.  we got it in july and its now dec and it wtill works but has some problems- the espresso isnt heated now- comes out cold.  and the steamer works sometimes.  i think that we just used it too much :)  i would order this again bc it is cheap and got the job done.  just wish that it would have lasted a bit longer.

bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: I bought this espresso maker to replace my Starbucks Barista machine that I used regularly for four years until it recently kicked the bucket. I read all the reviews and noted that while some people experienced leakage, others did not. I figured it was worth a shot, especially at such a great price. I don't need, nor can I afford, one of those $1,000+ espresso machines. I eagerly unpacked the espresso maker and proceeded to make my usual drink, a Caramel Macchiato. To my dismay, water began leaking onto my counter! I was so disappointed, as other than that, it made great espresso and frothed the milk wonderfully. I decided to try it once more before returning it, and I made sure to press the water tank firmly in place. No leakage! I've used it about a dozen times since with no leakage, so I am keeping it and hoping that first leak was a fluke. I would give it five stars except that I find it difficult to remove and replace the rubber frothing tube to clean it. It's quite snug, but I'm hoping it will loosen a bit with time.
title: Good machine for a great price
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: I love this coffee maker, it makes great specialty coffee's.  I have not had any issues with it so far.  I do wish the coffee was a little hotter but I'm going to clean and prime it again in the hope that it will help.  Follow the directions and make sure to prime it before using the first time.  The red matches the red of all my other kitchen appliances.

review_content: Love this thing.  Best bang for the buck when it comes to cappuccinos and lattes.
title: Four Stars
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: The terrific folks at Mr. Coffee sent me this to replace my much cheaper machine that quit working while still under warranty and I'm completely delighted with it! After spending a summer in Italy several years ago, where I enjoyed daily cappuccinos, I just couldn't drink regular drip coffee anymore. My previous cheap Mr. Coffees were okay but not great, though still better than drip. I use Italian Lavazza finely ground espresso coffees, and they make all the difference! I use unsweetened vanilla coconut-almond milk and love the amount of creamy froth this machine automatically gives, much better than the manual frother on my old machines! I hope this machine lasts a long time since I will have to shell out the bucks to replace it when it dies, I'm that sold on it!
title: Will never go back to cheap espresso machines!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
We picked this machine up around a week ago for my girlfriend who loves lattes. The espresso function works great and (provided you use the right grind of coffee for your espresso) turns out a delicious product. No complaints there!

Unfortunately, we were hoping for a bit more performance out of this thing, in particular in steaming and frothing milk. I bought it a week ago, and I think I'm still waiting for the damned milk to steam on my first latte... It takes FOREVER! The worst part is that you end up kind of loitering (there's not really any great place to leave the milk pitcher while you wait) for really around 15 to 20 minutes per trip. It sounds crazy, but that's as per the directions.

Infuriatingly, by the time the milk is heated, the coffee is cold... It kind of sucks...

Long story short, if you like espresso or different gourmet coffee based drinks, it's a great value! If you're buying it to create the lattes or cappucinos or other drinks they claim to be able to do, be warned!
title: Good value, but don't buy if you actually want a latte or cappucinno...
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Overall I am very pleased with the machine, especially the espresso and latte features. The frothing is really loud, just like at a coffee shop. I haven't tried the cappuccino setting yet. There are a few things about the design that I think are important to point out.

Filling the water container is easy, but you must either pull the entire unit away from the wall, or reach behind the machine to remove the water tank. You then must open the lid to access the handle, just a bit awkward.

The milk reservoir is very handy in that I can save any extra milk in the fridge until I need it again the next day. The machine will heat it up as it froths, so you can use the milk right out of the refrigerator. However, an issue with the milk container is how hard it can be to get connected and removed from the unit. If the milk container is not properly in place, the cappuccino and latte lights will blink. It was difficult to find the note about this in the users manual (it wasn't in the troubleshooting section). After brewing coffee, it can be difficult to then remove the milk container for storage in the fridge.

Finally, the espresso filter can be difficult to get on/off due to a very tight seal. The products produced thus far (espresso, latte) are very good and as good, if not better, than most purchased products such as Starbucks, Caribou, etc. Cleaning the machine is relatively easy and quick. Having a "cleaning" setting for the milk reservoir is great. The unit comes with two sizes of espresso filters (single and double), but provides no place to store the one not in use.
title: A few design tweaks maybe, but overall very good.
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
Brought this espresso maker at Walmart for about the same price.

Right of the box, it didn't work. Machine would get stuffed and not brew. After a few tries we decided to return it, and give Mr Coffee second chance.

We exchanged it for another one and it turns out that it worked like a charm. Ever since, its been flawless. Its quick and it brews nice strong coffee. Highly recommend if you are an espresso lover. Don't bother buying an expensive machine; this one does the job.

Be aware that Quality control is low, so the chances of running into a defective machine is likely. Purchase at a store with a "no questions asked and no hassle" return policy just in case. Once you get a working machine you'll fall in love with it.

UPDATE: 1/20/2013

After 8-10 months of use, it broke. All the moving parts inside and knobs to turn on and off are plastic. After a few months of use they become brittle and snap. The On and Off knob broke apart and something is rattling inside. Good for using once in a while like on weekends or a vacation home, not for everyday use.
title: Second time, a charm
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: Bought this machine from Mr Coffee directly a year ago. Love how it‚Äôs made, but man it doesn‚Äôt make you a good coffee. I don‚Äôt know why but any coffee I put in it has the same taste - and it‚Äôs a bad one. I‚Äôve even compared it to a regular coffee maker for 25 bucks which gives you more taste and aftertaste from good beans, this machine really ruins my experience. Not sure what is wrong, I take a good care of it but it just doesn‚Äôt do a tasty cup of a coffee
title: No coffee taste
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: The item does not have two drip heads - it is not a dual shot - as.  The handle is difficult to secure and turn and you have to hold the entire unit to remove the handle to empty the grinds.  The steaming head is a pain in that it has a rubber sleeve that has to be removed and cleaned after each use.  The catch tray is really shallow, too.  It's also really noisy.  I would not buy again and to be honest, if repackaging this appliance wasn't such a pain, I'd send it back.
title: Product is not as pictured and isn't worht the money
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: I purchased this espresso machine a year ago from Wal-Mart. I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase! I worked as a barista for 8+ years and worked as a trainer for a corporate coffee franchise. This definitely meets my standards at this price point. Proper cleaning/maintenance is always necessary, but it is very user friendly. I'll be using this machine for years to come.
title: I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Just let me say that this thing makes great cappuccino...as good as Starbucks or Caribou.  I've owned two of these units in the past 12 months and both have broke.  The first unit lasted about 3 months.  The metal steaming tip broke off one day while I was cleaning it (I cleaned the plastic shroud, arm and outside tip every time I used it).  Thankfully the store replaced it with a new unit.  The second machine was good for the next 8 months until the plastic piece that holds the metal band and handle to the carafe broke.  I would estimate I used the 2nd unit between 40 to 50 times.  I washed the carafe in the dishwasher probably 20 times and it still looks almost new.  My next machine will be a different brand, hopefully with more durability.  If you buy this machine plan on buying a steaming pitcher (if you want to make good cappuccino) and a coffee tamper.  The directions say to use the included scoop to tamp the coffee but that method isn't very effective.
title: Great Cappuccino - Poor Durability
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
We received this package around 230 pm yesterday, an hour later we had it cleaned of all shipping materials and stickers and were running the prime cycle.
By midnight we had already had 3 different drinks each and I was marveling at how much money we had saved versus going out for those same drinks. We are still experimenting with the tamper and froth settings as both are nuanced in turning out slightly different products. This is my first machine of the sort and im glad i went with Mr. Coffee and read the reviews.

The espresso is strong and the froth is frothier than expected. Do be sure to prime the machine first. Then use espresso beans, preferably ground just before brewing, for the best taste. Would absolutely recommend. Thanks man.
title: My girl says its the "bomb diggity!!!!!".
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: This thing is great. I feel like all of the negative reviews are coming from people who want to make a living selling espresso professionally out of their home or something. I use this thing practically every day, and using it has been nothing but a breeze. Last year, I lived with a friend who had a fully automatic espresso machine, and admittedly that was pretty cool. You'd just keep it stocked with whole beans and water and then getting a couple shots was a matter of pushing one button. Well, I just buy pre-ground espresso and honestly using this thing isn't much harder than that. The water reservoir is pretty big (over a month and a half I have only refilled it once so far), the espresso is plenty strong (honestly, if you're like an 8/10 on the "I like espresso scale" then it will be plenty strong for you..)  The drip tray is great, I've just emptied it once and given it a little rinse. Cleaning the thing after uses is a breeze. If you were looking to make multiple shots in a row that would be a little challenging since the little arm thing would be pretty hot probably, but I'm usually just making one cup at a time so I can let it cool in between. I love it. Much recommended, easy five star. This is only 1 of like 3 products that I have probably ever bothered reviewing.
title: Great Espresso Machine. Love it.
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: I had to replace the plastic cover over the steam nossile with one from an old machine to get it to work properly and the filler cap sure was not designed with anyone with any kind of problem with their hands. it is very hard to grip
title: I had to replace the plastic cover over the steam ...

review_content:
I bought this machine based on it's reported ability to make good espresso. It does produce lots of nice looking crema, but being cappuccino drinkers, I'm not sure this makes much difference. I had a smaller Krups steam machine before, which didn't make as much crema, but the resultant cappuccino was just as good as what I get from this Mr. C.

My only complaint is that the 2 cup filter basket is too small, much smaller than what we had on our Krups model. To get our two large cappa's each morning I have to empty and refill. Were it not for this hassle, I would have given 5 stars. Otherwise all other aspects of this modern marvel are working well after 3 weeks of being in service.

*** Update 1.5 years later: Unit broke after 1.5 years of once daily use. Not bad for $65 price, but now that it's $95 I may look for other options. BTW, never found it necessary to clean or descale, just purge the wand with a blast of steam after each use (I threw away the rubber tip so no milk residue problem). Still would like the large filter size to be twice as big.
title: Good, but needs a larger filter basket

title: coffee ECM160 do not work like steam espresso

It still works, but it sometimes runs out of pressure before the milk is sufficiently steamed. I have not taken it apart to see if I can find it yet. title: Coffee espresso machine but this model is the worst.

review_content:
Years ago we had an early model of this Espresso Machine, but after a couple of years of daily use, it wore out. We then moved up to a Mr. Coffee pump model. It was OK, but not great. When that wore out we moved up to a Delongi pump model. It was disappointing, very slow, but we used it for a couple of years.

The other day, we decide to go back down-scale and purchased this Espresso Machine. We couldn't be happier. We drink lattes, and I think these are at least as good as what we get at either Micky D's or Starbucks. It brews and froths very quickly. I thought about moving up to one the expensive ($500+) automatic Italian machines, but in the end decided to go this way. Even if we have to replace it every couple of years, I think it is still a great deal.
title: This is a great little espresso machine
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
This espresso maker worked like a dream for the first year and then for no reason the steamer function stopped working.

When it was working properly the espresso always had a nice crema and the steamer made nice frothed milk. Aside from it not lasting, it is a very loud machine and when the espresso function is working the machine shakes a lot.

All in all, I'd say it was well worth it for an affordable espresso machine. I used it 4-5 times per week for one year. It certainly saved me a lot of money.
title: This espresso maker worked like a dream for the first year and then for ...
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
Got this a year ago for just under 40$
I use it daily, sometimes twice a day
Have had no problems with it
Makes great mochas (Ghirardelli white chocolate powder Smuckers caramel syrup makes better white mochas then Starbucks at a fraction of the price)
It can be hard to find the Ghirardelli white chocolate powder in stores so I just order it online, its still cheap. You can get 10 lbs for 50$ including shipping. Lasts a long time.
Everything works the way its supposed too
Follow the instructions and use the vinegar to clean it when it starts to slow down and it will keep working like new
I wipe it down after each use to keep it clean, still looks like new
All the parts are still strong

After 1 year with the proper care its still working like new! you cant find a cheaper espresso maker.
Even if you had to replace it after a year it would still be worth 40$
My parents have paid for espresso makers 4 times more then this and had nothing but problems.

If this ever dies on me I'm just going to buy another one.
Can't recommend this enough

The steamed milk could be steamed longer but by the time it gets warm its already doubled capacity. Going any longer really waters down the flavors. With that said, the thing has been a little trooper with all the use it gets. No leaking, no issues. Really great device for the price.

bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Yeah this is supposed to be obvious I guess but I'm new at this and followed the directions in the book.

This wasn't in the book.

I thought it was broken until I came across another post here that mentions adding extra water for steam. WOWEEEEE! This is one heck of a frother!

I've had a Tassimo brewer for a long time. While I love it, the coffee is hard to find in my area (hate ordering online and paying shipping!) and it's become too expensive. I have no idea how to grind or brew and wanted an idiot proof cheaper way of getting my espresso/latte fix in the morning. This is the answer! Follow the directions, easy to use and the best thing about it is - Gevalia Espresso roast by the pound in Walmart (my favorite choice in pods for the Tassimo) is ground perfectly for this - no worries! I have the taste I love and the best steamed milk for much less!

I highly reccommend this for those who can't afford to run to the coffee houses anymore but don't want a machine that takes a week of classes to learn to use.
title: Add extra water for the steamer to work!  Great Buy!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I bought the Mr Coffee espresso machine after reading reviews on Amazon. The espresso it makes is okay, but somewhat bitter. My brother owns a very high end espresso machine. After visiting him for a long weekend, it took me nearly a week to be able to stand the taste of Mr Coffee espresso again. I also had the opportunity to taste Mr Coffee espresso in contrast to the Krups steam espresso maker, which is a more apples-to-apples comparison. It's unfortunate that the reliability of Krups's maker is so poor, because the taste of its espresso is much closer to the high end side.

All this would lead me to give the Mr Coffee machine a 3 star rating. What lowered it to 2 stars was that after only 2 years of use, the espresso/off/steam knob completely broke off, and I have to throw the machine out and buy a new one. Once it broke, I saw that the mechanism is plastic. Presumably after a couple of years of heating and cooling, the plastic must have become brittle. The plastic part just shattered, and there's no way to repair it. So now I will pay another $39 for a Mr Coffee espresso machine or a little more for a different steam espresso maker, with the knowledge that 2 - 3 years down the line, I'll have to buy another one yet again.

Maybe my brother has the right idea ... buy a really quality espresso machine, and never pay again. His has been running daily for over 10 years.
title: After two years, the on/off knob broke
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Grandma and Grandpa were right. Never a bad Mr. Coffee machine. This little machine is THE BEST. I previously ordered a $150 Cusinart machine THE EM200 ONE BUT IT DID NOT WORK. THIS ONE DID. I am going back and forth with this Waste Direct people and that one was a waste of money. When I mailed that one back, the Waste King Direct folks said they would not refund my $144 dollars back. I put in an Amazon claim a month ago about that place yet to hear anything back about it.

But tis one bad apple among the good many. I will never order from Waste King again.

THIS ONE FOR $40 IN Target WORKS. But I had one of these machines BEFORE. I should have remembered because when something works a dozen years before.... buy another one. Just that the old one the seal wore out because I used it so so much.

GOOD FREAKN JOB MR. COFFEE. You need to teach Cuisinart a thing or two. Fantastic machine.
title: FANTASTIC FOR THE MONEY.  GO MR. COFFEE GO.
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I registered for this item on my wedding registry. I spent 3 days researching and reading reviews of different espresso machines. I finally decided on this one. Well, I got it and was so excited to use it. I went out and bought the espresso and milk. I opened the box, and realized that it doesn't come with a tamper or a milk frothing cup. On the bottom on the scoop is a flat part that the manual states is the tamper. Let me tell you, it doesn't work at all.

I brewed my espresso shot, and put some milk in a cup to froth it. I followed the directions in the manual. The frothing wand just spewed the milk everywhere. I didn't even have enough milk left in my cup to even TRY to froth. Since that first day, all I have done is brew the espresso and add it to a cup of cold milk and ice.

Also, I keep getting the grind in my espresso. I have tried tamping down harder and using a different grind. Nothing has worked.

Bottom line: I am going to return to Amazon for a different machine. Very disappointed in this one.

review_content: More like 3.5 stars. Good machine for cappuccinos or lattes, but straight espresso is just poor quality. That should be expected from most steam machines, so I wasn't too surprised. This does what you would expect for the price. If you're into lattes, mochas, or cappuccinos, you should be reasonably happy with this one. If you want a decent home espresso, spend more money on a pump driven machine (although you're probably never going to get coffee house taste for a straight espresso anyway).

Sorry Starbucks and local coffee house, I'm makin' my own!

p.s. I use the espresso maker and not the frothing attachment, and so can only tell you about the espresso.

review_content:
I purchased this machine a little over 2 years ago and it's held up nicely.

However, you aren't getting "espresso" as it is known in the coffee world. Basically it's a percolator with a steaming wand that's built to look like an espresso machine. And for the price, it's quite good. Easy to clean and operate.

The main cons are that your frothed milk isn't very consistent, even though I've gotten quite good at it over the last two years, it's very touchy and needs to have the nozzle cleaned from inside or you'll get different results.

Just keep in mind you're not getting real espresso with crema.

review_content: I'm a barista, I've owned 3 latte machines, I use a large machine daily at work. This by far is the worst one ever! Not only is the description wrong but it made my latte taste terrible! I used fresh ground espresso  from work that I drink daily and did everything it said, not only are the directions off but I personally feel it ruined the espresso. Items they say are included are not. I knew it was cheap but holding it I felt like I was going to break it. Very cheaply made. Honestly the last 3 Mr coffee latte machines I had were wonderful! I've wasted my money here! Wishing I had gotten the other model!

bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: I have enjoyed daily espressos from this machine now for over 5 years.  It is quick and takes up hardly any room on the counter top.  Not sure why anyone would need to spend hundreds of dollars for a fancy espresso machine as long as this one stays on the market.  Actually just ordered a second one to stick up in the closet in case mine finally wears out so I have a replacement!
title: Best Little Espress Machine for the Money!!!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Well, I'm surprised this little guy has lasted 2 years, daily use , for one person, I expected it to fall apart, but its still going strong. I mainly bought this for the steamer, and boy, can it steam, take off the plastic sleeve thingy and use just the metal wand. I steam rice milk, which is the hardest to steam, this make it very bubbly, so make sure to tap out the bubbles a bit. I use a smaller steaming pitcher, like a 8 oz size, and just steam more as I need it. If you add a tablespoon of soy milk to your rice milk, it makes it super smooth foam. And don't use "light" rice/soy milk, its too watered down. I was a barista back in the day, so I know how to work it. But the espresso this machine makes is not that great, I'm not a espresso connoisseur so I'm fine with it. Yes, you have to grind the beans finer & I tamp it down firm. And weirdly enough, when I turn the knob from espresso to steam, the espresso keeps dripping out in big foamy puffs, hmmmm. I don't advise refilling to make another batch right after the first, it just doesn't seem to work. Do like a previous reviewer said and fill reservoir with extra water. Make sure you empty out all the steam inside when your done, its easy to clean the steam wand that way but just putting full water in your steam pitcher and let it heat up, it melts of the milk and wipe it clean when steams done.

UPDATE: Dec 2012. It finally broke after 3 years of use. So for the cheap price, I can't complain. I did love the steam wands position & strength, but it never pulled really adequate espresso shots.
title: Great steamer, cheap price
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I bought this Mr. Coffee ECM160 to replace a horrible Krups machine. This Mr. Coffee is a basic, fast espresso machine and makes a decent pot of cappuccino. Price is quite reasonable.

1. My biggest gripe is that the two-foot cord is too darn short! And yes, I know it has cord storage in the base. The cord should be at least three feet long so I can situate it properly on the kitchen counter.

2. A smaller problem is the design of the smooth tapered cap on top and the smooth rounded knob on the left. The conical shape makes these awkward to handle; standard knurled knobs would be much better.

3. Yet another issue is the catch tray under the carafe; an awkward two-part tray that is difficult to separate and clean. Plus the plastic lid fits loosely on the carafe and falls off when you pour the coffee.

Poor ergonomics, but decent espresso.

UPDATE: After three plus years of reliable service, my Mr. Coffee ECM160 finally died. The "On/Off/Steam" switch finally failed. Still, for the price, three years of daily service ain't bad! I replaced it with a similar unit, the Jarden MrC Steam Espresso Maker, which I like just a bit better.
title: Okay, but several design flaws. UPDATE--RIP
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I received one as a gift and am very happy with it. If you are a connoisseur like me you may have been shopping by bars of pressure VS: price. I was caught off guard with this one as a gift and I love it. I stopped shopping - I don't care about bars - it does the job.

I paid just as much for a stainless steel Italian stove top unit that delivers weaker coffee and is harder to clean. Also, you have to replace the gasket on these often or they spit water out onto your burner and fail to brew.

This little unit will pay for itself quickly if you give up Starbucks for it. I do not use the milk frothier so you will have to read on for that. As for making rich tasting espresso, you can't beat it for the price. To be honest, it doesn't leave wishing I had a more expensive one. It renders a moderate amount of "la crema".

The secret with any espresso maker is the finest ground bean possible. Either grind it yourself or use the grinders they have at the grocery stores with the bulk coffee, and set it to the finest (Turkish). Do not use pre-pakaged grinds, they are too coarse and will turn out weaker coffee in any machine.
title: Can't do better for the price
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I've had two of these Mr Coffee espresso machines now for 10 years. The first one lasted me about seven years, and I've had my second one for three. I've abused them heavily, every morning. I don't mind that the first one started to fail after seven years, as I got so much use out of it. That's 365 days a year for seven years, so about 2,555 uses? This second one I've used about 1,095 times so far and it's still going strong.
Now I think about how much money I've saved over the years. I am admittedly a 2 double-shot mocha a day addict. I am not sure the going rate of a double shot mocha at Starbucks these days as I haven't been to one in years, but I'd imagine my espresso machine probably paid for itself in the first month.
title: Stood up to daily use for three years so far
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
After 5 or 6 years of almost daily use I decided to replace my slowley dying DeLonghi 15 bar pump machine. This is about the same price and same written spec so when I had the chance to pick up a new one for $40 one day I grabbed it.
The Plus, and it is a big one for me, MUCH stronger steam Frother.
The Minus, much noisier and sounds like it won't last near as long. Time will tell.
title: Very strong Frother
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
I love this machine, I really do, but I'm posting this review with the hope that someone can help me solve a problem with the frother.

When I hit the button to run a latte or capuccino cycle, the machine sometimes whirs and churns for about 10-15 seconds before it produces any frothed milk. (You can see what's happening in the video I've posted.)

The espresso brews flawlessly, the only issue is with the frothing.

Has anyone else had this happen to them? Anyone know how to fix this?
title: Great little machine, but problem with the frother
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: I own three espresso machines including this one. All three work. One cost $300 (De'Longhi), one was this one, and one cost $70 (Breville) on sale. I would give this one a 3 out of 5 stars, pretty much exactly what the other users' average rating is giving it right now. This espresso maker forms almost no crema on the espresso, which is the difference between a good and a cheap espresso. The plastic pieces are cheap and a bit bizarre, but it's a work-horse of a machine. In a pinch, it'll make you an espresso, but if you're a bit of a snob like me you know what to do.
title: Not for snobs like me, but not horrible either
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
For those who are seeking an espresso machine that produces an excellent crema and works well this would be an excellent choice. While there are several cheaper espresso machines available, these operate using steam and not pressure and should be avoided. The Mr. Coffee ECMP50 has an actual pump which makes all the difference when good crema is desired. I use lavazza and illy espresso and when ground and tamped properly this machine has sufficient pressure to produce a very nice crema.

After reading the reviews for this product I was a little apprehensive at first, but based on some of the other positive reviews I decided to take a chance and purchase this machine. After using this machine for quite some time without any failures I can safely say that this model is a great machine when compared to some of the other more expensive models. While the body is indeed made of plastic, the portafilters, baskets and drip tray grid and steam wand are indeed quality solid metal. It should be noted that the steam wand plastic tip was removed for better (and more sanitary) milk frothing.

The majority of the negative comments posted by other consumers are all valid points but if one treats this machine with care and keeps it clean after every use each of these issues can be avoided:

-Pertaining to the issues of leaking: The removable reservoir has a small valve at the bottom which is only engaged when the removable reservoir is in place. Make sure this is down all the way before you fill up your water, make sure that the reservoir is completely seated in the base of the machine and there should not be any problems with initial leaking. It should be noted that when the pump purges and cleans itself for the next brew/steam cycle it expels it's contents into the drip tray. When I first purchased the machine and ran the "water only" cycle for the steam wand and brew function the drip tray filled up very quickly. Since I empty the drip tray often and makes sure the reservoir is seated properly I have had no issues with any water on my counter.

-Pertaining to the machine itself: If you read the manual completely and clean the machine after every use there will be no problems with the pump breaking after only a few uses. To be safe and extend the life of the machine, after I am done making my espressos for the day I remove the reservoir and empty the water, as well as purge remaining water from the wand (the machine does it for you but there is still a little water left in the pump). When turning the machine on again, I prime the pump according to the directions in the manual. By priming the pump according to the directions whenever the machine is turned on and purging the pump when the machine will be turned off you will considerably extend the life of your pump. Keeping the portafilter and brewhead clean of any espresso grounds as well as not storing the portafilter in the brewhead will keep the brewhead itself from eventually leaking.

-Pertaining to the cup warmer: the reviews are true, the cup warmer gets lukewarm at best but I have had such excellent results with this machine for the past 6 months, for the price and quality of espresso this is an easy con to look past.

Treat this machine with care and maintain it properly, read the manual and get to know the machines quirky functions (what the lights mean). When used properly this machine can produce a shot of espresso that rivals that of a more expensive $100-$300 espresso machine.
title: Even reading the other reviews I can say this is a great machine
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: NO IDEA what the bad reviews are about. I don't usually take the time to complete reviews but we have been so impressed with this, I had to share. I have had this for over one year and it still works GREAT! It is without question made of cheaper materials than others, but since we were uncertain whether we wanted another appliance taking up counter space, we went cheap assuming if we didn't like it it was not a great loss. What a pleasant surprise! After a great deal of use it is still going strong. After moving to Maine from the west coast we missed our great coffee shops but this little guy has helped reduce the pain. Makes a great cup of espresso! Let's face it though, the machine has little to do with the quality of the drink, it's really about the bean. If you are looking to impress your friends, are rough on appliances, or refuse to read instruction manuals, this is probably not the machine for you. If, on the other hand, you want a reliable machine that takes up little counter space and makes a great cup quickly without reaching deeply into your wallet, this is your machine!
title: After one year, still working great!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: This machine makes a decent cup of espresso and it does a decent job of frothing milk. Since the first time I used the unit it has vibrated to the extent that any cup moves away from the spouts, it is also excessively noisy when operating in my opinion. Another thing that annoys me is the fact that with every brew, the filter is always full of liquid when I remove it. I grind my own beans, I have tried different coffees, different grinds, different tamping, no tamping at all and I have never failed to have liquid in the filter. I think I'll shop for a different Espresso Maker

title: Great product. I don't use it every day
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
My expensive espresso maker died so I bought this one to make do until I can get another "good one" . After having this one for a few weeks now I can happily say that I don't need to buy a good one . This Mr.Coffee machine is a good ! It heats up lightning fast and produces good espresso .
One issue with most cheaper machines is that they don't produce good creme . This machine does . It comes with a single and double shot portafilter insert and the removable water tank is a nice feature . It doesn't take up a lot of counter space is is stylish enough to fit into any upscale kitchen . Granted it doesn't have all the bells and whistles that a high priced machine has but at a fraction of the cost it more then makes up for it .
title: After having this one for a few weeks now I can happily say that I don't need to buy a good ...
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: I have had this machine for about a week now.  I ordered it on Amazon.  When it came, I read the owners manual twice, and followed the directions for priming.  I have been careful to obey all warnings and suggestions.  When I tried it for the first time, I selected cappuccino. On the milk frother, I turned the dial to 'cappuccino' which means maximum froth.  It filled the cup with coffee, and made a beautiful crema, but the milk-frothing thing never happened.  No steamed milk came out of the tube that sticks out of the milk reservoir.  Then I followed the directions for manually frothing milk.  Still nothing happened.  I looked at the tubes, nothing clogged.  I knew the milk reservoir was locked correctly in place.  The water reservoir was filled to the max, etc, so for the last week, I have not been able to steam/froth milk.  That was disappointing, because actually that was the reason I bought the machine.  So I've just added milk directly to the cappuccino, and it tastes like a latte.  It actually tastes very good.  Another odd thing about this machine.  When I turn it on, the portafilter drips.  It drips before I select cappuccino.  It even drips after the cappuccino is made.  It never stops dripping, so that I actually never know when my drink is done.  It's rather confusing.  One more thing I thought yall might like to know about.  When I first saw this machine on Amazon, it was advertized as $200.  Then, in the same browser, I checked Wall Mart, and the same machine was sold for $130.  Then I happened to go back to Amazon and saw that MAGICALLY, the price for the same machine, NEW was $130.  HA!  So actually that's how much I paid for it.  Interesting trick, isn't it?  I would like to get a new machine, since there is a one year warranty on it.  However, this machine is Chinese, and ultimately I'm going to have to pony over the big bucks and eventually buy German, or Swiss German for something quality and long lasting.
title: Something is wrong with this machine
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
Within 2 months, the handle for the coffee pot disintegrated and a month later the handle for the Portafilter disintegrated.
This was purchased as a replacement for a Mr. Coffee that looked identical with the new one. The previous Mr. Coffee lasted about 15 years, and the electrical parts wore out before the handles did.
It appears that the quality of this model of Mr. Coffee has declined to where it is not useful and not a good value.
title: Not a good buy
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: We had one for 10 months.  For the cheap price, we accepted that it slowed down and took forever in the end and decided to replace it -- since we love the small size and ease of using it. From then on, we had bad luck.  The first replacement made very loud noise, steam and pressure were extreme, the second time it actually exploded -- leaving a huge mess.  Coffee and coffee grinds all over.  I had to unplug it to stop it.  To touch it was too dangerous because of the enourmous amount of hot steam that burnt my hand when I tried to turn it off. Amazon was great, told us to dispose of it and sent us another one for free.  Again, a major disappointment.  The top part was leaking all over (with the first attempts of use), so that in the end not much water would find its way into the carafe.  This one, like the other one, had also a nasty smell -- like burning rubber. Again, Amazon, was great and refunded the money. Conclusion:  machine is very cheap, and so is the manufacturing and the quality control.
title: potentially dangerous
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: Just as advertised, this is the basic model of espresso machine that can still achieve 15 bar pressure and produce a good cup of espresso with crema.  I've been using it with much success for 3 weeks now and I don't miss my regular coffee maker.  That said, it definitely doesn't seem to be built to last.  It is lightweight with plastic parts that seem like they'll wear out over time.  But this is a great product to try before you spend $600 on a higher quality machine, to see if you like the espresso lifestyle.
title: Worth the Price, You Get Good Crema, But Don't Expect Commercial Quality
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: I'm so glad I bought this.  The lattes I make are better than the coffee house I go to at work.  I only wish the space for cups was larger.  To get around it I use a smaller cup make the espresso pour it into my larger cup then froth and steam the milk and pour that into my larger cup.  Like a few other people I lost the plastic straw on the frother the first few weeks I had it but I bought 2 replacement straws from Mr Coffee they are super cheap and I received them in about 5 days.
title: Love my Latte Maker
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: I've had this machine for around 2 months now. It has made at least one 2oz shot per day 7 days a week. I really like this machine it makes excellent tasting espresso. Produces a rich thick crema with a full body. My only minor thing I'm not 100% happy with is the noise and vibration level at brewing. But it's only a very minor issue of mine. I would definitely buy another one if it quit working tomorrow. Very satisfied. Another good product from the people at Mr. Coffee.
title: Excellent entry level espresso maker
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
My latte habit was out of control... and I'm vegan so I need to go to a high end place like Starbucks so I can get a SOY caramel latte. When I figured out that I could have had my kitchen counters re-done for what I spend at Starbucks in 6 months (!), I knew I had to learn to make my own lattes.

I bought this little sweetheart and gave it to the DH for the kids to give me for xmas. I read all the reviews and the directions, plus looked up Starbucks syrup-pump volumes online. So I knew there would be no tamper per se (the scoop is the tamper) or pitcher (I just use a ceramic syrup pitcher). And I knew how much syrup I wanted (see recipe below).

First time out, the brew was bitter and the milk was cold. The directions say that too fine a grind makes a bitter brew (oops), but I knew from the reviews (thanks, reviewers!)that your tamp can compensate for that. So since my grind is too fine, I tamped very lightly the second time - that fixed that problem. Also my milk wasn't steamed enough because I hadn't put enough extra water in the reservoir for steaming - the second time I followed the instruction manual amounts for cappuccino, which gave me enough extra water with which to steam my milk. Problems solved! Latte was perfect that second time around.

My recipe for grande soy caramel latte: Espresso for 2 cups, water for 2 cups cappuccino (manual says 5.5 oz but I know that 6 oz = 3/4 cup so I just throw in 3/4 cup because that's easier...), brew, plus 1/8 cup of syrup (grande = 4 pumps ... at .35 oz per pump, per the SB website, 4 pumps= about 1.5 oz = which is more than 1/8 cup, but I want a little less sugar), plus 4ish oz vanilla soy milk (or milk of choice of course)- steamed. Put the syrup in your mug first, then the brewed espresso, then pour the steamed soy milk while using a spoon to hold back the foam, then use the spoon to plop the foam on the top. YUM! :) Enjoy!
title: YAY!  First timer here - making perfect lattes within minutes!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Good but doesn't steam got enough. It's not adjustable on how Long you can steam milk.

Also if doing double shot Cappuccino, a tall glass to accommodate doesn't fit.
It's a Balancing act to remove tall mug.
Straightforward otherwise.
I do have to microwave after To get hot enough. Loses 2 stars for the high price these Should've been addressed/fixed in creating It.
title: Good but doesn't steam got enough
bought_model: Color: RedStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: The item works great. Perfect if you don't have a lot of time, but want a good espresso. The automatic frothing is awesome, especially if you prefer a cappuccino or latte! The espresso quality probably wouldn't pass the test of an espresso snob or someone wanting to impress their friends with their crazy expensive machine. If you just want a GOOD EASY EASY EASY espresso drink at home, this is the machine for you! My husband and I are juggling work and 2 babies and this is so easy we can manage to fix and drink two cappuccinos every morning before work.

I went to Amazon site to return and it has only a 30 day return policy.

title: Overall good machine for the price
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I'm no coffee snob, not looking for a perfect cup of espresso but want to be able to make a mocha every morning and get a little fancy without having to pay $5 a day. This is the perfect little machine for that. It gets the job done! With that said, I had this for about a week working perfectly until one day I went to froth the milk and noticed, half my milk was missing out of the carafe. Early morning me thought I was going insane. Where could the milk have gone? I thought maybe I had just not put as much milk in as I thought, looked everywhere in case I had a small stroke and poured it out somewhere random. Checked the condensation line on the carafe and I had indeed had more milk in there. Open the water reservoir on the machine and there was my milk. It had inverted pressure and sucked it back up into the maker. I have read a good majority of the reviews on the product and never saw that mentioned, so I am hoping it was just a freak thing. Packed it back up, sent it back to amazon who sent me a new one and have it up and running fine. If this new one works out well I will come back and give more stars, but until it proves its worth, it only gets 3 stars.

Update-
I have had my replacement maker for a few weeks now. I have to say I kind of miss the old one. The frother on this machine isn't as consistent with heating as the last one, however, this one also hasn't inverted milk. I just opt to only use the espresso maker and nuke my milk in the microwave (I know, sacrilege). Cheap machine. If you want more, then pay more on something different.
title: Great for a week...then it broke
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: This espresso maker is just Ok. I'd say give it a pass as you can get a better or equivalent espresso maker for cheaper. The main issue I had with it is the automatic milk frother doesn't seem to work that well, though this could just be an issue with mine. Also it can be a bit of a pain to keep clean. There are some parts that the manual says cannot be cleaned in the dishwasher, and these parts are a bit hard to hand clean I think. Like the water tank. So basically for me this product was a bit of a disappointment especially considering the price. I suspected initially before purchasing this product that the automatic milk frother wouldn't work as advertised, and was disappointment to be proven correct on that. Also compared to my previous $100 espresso maker, it didn't seem to work any better. Just had more bells and whistles that I ended up never using.
title: Give this a pass and look for a better/cheaper espresso maker
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
This machine had such potential. I had it for about a month and used it almost every morning for a latte before it quit working.

Pro: It was much easier, faster, and quieter than my last espresso machine. I really love it even over the negatives I have below.
Pro: self clean cycle is great - I still have some rinsing to do with the milk but this is so much easier than using a traditional milk frother where the milk gets caked on the nozzle.

Con: One thing I overlooked when purchasing this is the space for a cup. I use a 32 oz Tervis to travel with my coffee, this doesn't fit in the space. I can tilt it so that it just barely gets the coffee and milk in the cup but I have to stand there and hold the cup the whole time. It doesn't take long, but when i'm trying to get my 2 little ones ready for church, I have better things that I could be doing.

Con: Milk Reservoir - i had trouble keeping this from smelling like spoiled milk. i ended up emptying the milk everyday and rinsing it with soapy water and leaving it out to dry. when i stored it in the fridge with milk for the next day, i had to scrub it out once or twice to get it smelling right.

Con: it quit working. It started just making noise when I was trying to froth milk and I couldn't get it to make coffee or milk or even run the clean cycle. In frustration, I hit the top of it fairly hard with my fist and it started working. The next morning, I had to hit it twice to get it to make my morning coffee. I don't have time to coax it into doing what it was made to do. I tried to return it but it started having trouble about a week after the 30 day return period on Amazon. I'm going to try to use the the manufacture's warranty to get a replacement.
title: loved it until I hated it.
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
Bought August died October as so many have stated. Mr Coffee sent me a non pump machine to stand in for a replacement that is currently unavailable. When it gets in stock, I will get a new one replaced by them.
Upshot, it‚Äôs a pain to have to live with sub quality coffe (can‚Äôt really say espresso) until that happens, but kudos to Mr. Coffee for filling the gap) like so many have said, you can‚Äôt beat the price $.13 per shot for what you get!

update: After waiting a couple of months for the machine to be in stock, they sent me the replacement. I'm back in the game pulled my first shot this morning. I'm grateful that Mr Coffee is willing to do what they need to do to keep me as a loyal customer. BTW, during this time, my regular mr coffee drip pot when up after 5 years... I tried to clean the inside and got the front electronics wet and fried :-( I happily replaced it for $30 and another 5 years of coffee bliss.

Suggestions:
Keep old machines for replacement parts.

Get replacement warranty so after the one year lapses you can just have it replaced.

Enjoy your $0.13 per espresso!

review_content:
This little machine produces absolutely delicious espresso, and I am a real enthusiast. Only minor criticism is that it could be a little hotter, so you will have to heat your cup properly.
For 67$ you simply can't beat it (that's about 25 espressos at Starbucks ...).
Like many of the cheap espresso machines, mine failed after about a year of use (if you want a durable product, you will have to spend much more), but Mr Coffee replaced it for free with a new one under their warranty. Compare this to the outrageous so called warranty of Breville who charges you 35 to 50$ to get a replacement refurbished machine!!
5 stars all the way, within the limitations of its price point.
title: Great product, amazing value, stellar warranty
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
I have only tried the pod-based espresso/latte machines and I did not like them for the dependency on the pods. I didn't want to spend a ridiculous amount of money, but I wanted to be able to have a Latte with Real milk, not a powdered pod. Here are my two cents....

Pros:
It makes consistently Hot, flavorful coffee. Follow the instructions and use finely ground, preferably espresso type, coffee. I tried "regular" coffee, and while it was good, it was more like a caffe con leche than a Latte. I use Cafe Bustello. It's fabulous.

The milk froths pretty well. I've messed with the "dial" to get different amounts of froth, and it's pretty straightforward.

Easy to follow the instructions, easy to run thru the cleaning cycle. Heats up pretty quick too.

The scooper/tamper is easy to use and convenient and the adjustable shelf for smaller cups is pretty cute.

Cons:
Damn - it's Noisy. Not sure if that's true of all of these kind of machines, but when the whole house is silent, it echos!

You HAVE to clean the milk container - especially the "arm" every time. I use the cleaning cycle, but still need to wipe it with a wet paper towel. Amazing how quick hot milk builds up (and smells) on that arm. Again, this could be true with all of these machines, i don't know.

Overall, I love it. You don't need any special supplies, filters or anything like that.
title: Pretty Good Machine - I love it.

review_content: This is the worst espresso machine I have ever used. I am a coffee geek, writing a book on coffee and have run an Italian restaurant where  I used every kind of espresso machine from $1000 to $50.00.  I have consistently used Krups in the past and their machines lasted for personal use at least 5 years.  Not having the cash to purchase anything for now other than an inexpensive machine, I decided to try this one.  The price was right and there were many good reviews.  I should have known better.  I only buy really good coffee beans, organic dark roast ones.  It is the only luxury I allow myself.  This machine manages to make the best coffee taste awful.  It makes a brew that is tepid at best and the frothing attachment is useless unless you want a milk shower.  I gave it a fair chance and now the 30 days return is up so it will spend the rest of its life in the trash. If you love coffee don't buy this machine. review_content:
I am in remote location overseas and desired a budget solution to make my own espresso. I bought this machine for the low price to make espresso at the office. Here are a few comments.

The machine makes adequate espresso for what it is. You can not expect it to make the same quality drink as a higher brand such as Di Longhi or Saeco. With the coffee dispensing out of a single drip mechanism, it puts the entire shot in a mini coffee pot. The coffee has a descent taste to it, a little bitter due to the shot becoming dead while trying to fill the entire pot. It dispenses with crema(Light colored foamy part of an espresso shot) about half way. The initial trickle drip is slow and dark and starts to foam about after ten seconds.

The coffee will get a slight burnt taste if allowed to drip to the full 4 shot mark on the pot. This is due to the steam being fully charged near the end of the dispensing. Once you are done the grounds pop out in a nice packed chunk, My only critique of this type of machine, (not just this brand) is that you can not pre-heat the water. If you wanted to steam the milk first then brew the coffee you can not really do it because there is not enough time to steam the water. You can only brew coffee first, then turn the lever to the steam position to actuate the wand. All in all if you are in a pinch and are looking for a quick disposable machine where you can leave it behind without being without some coin this is a good machine for the money.
title: It does the job for a low priced machine
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I love having the ability to make my own espresso at home. I have nothing but good things to say about the quality of the espresso I get out of this. However, I would LOVE to be able to have extra filters ready to go before I start brewing the first two shots. (I'll admit to a major caffeine problem to the tune of eight shots before I leave for work.) If I had the others ready to go, I could speed up the process immeasurably. I have looked high and low for extra filters and filter baskets that definitely fit this machine and haven't turned up anything promising yet.

There are several other things that detract from a more positive rating but they're attributable to my own inexperience with espresso brewing. I'm slowly getting the hang of it and this machine is probably much easier to operate than some of the others I considered buying, so the fact that it's "teaching" me is in it's favor.
