review_content:
I am a coffee lover and was so excited about purchasing this machine. I have had the machine for about 2 months now and only use a couple times a week because it requires a lot of cleaning.
Cons: In order to make a latte, the milk holder needs to be filled up. If it gets too low, the machine will not use the last inch of milk in the container. I find myself wasting milk, and I hate wasting food. I have tried refrigerating the milk in the container after I make a drink then topping the container off with fresh milk before making the next drink. Also, I can‚Äôt tell you how many times I‚Äôve forgotten to but the little metal frother thing in my cup before brewing, and ended up with a puddle of milk to clean ( okay the last con is totally on me). Don‚Äôt try making a latte when people are sleeping, it is super loud. Lastly, I find the espresso container really difficult to put in. Maybe it‚Äôs just my machine but I really need to put some muscle in to putting the darn thing in the machine.

Pros: makes a descent shot of espresso. I don‚Äôt like the lattes. I prefer to not use the milk frother and just use the espresso and mix with warm milk.

I purchased this machine based on all of the positive reviews, and am surprised by how little I like it.
title: Just okay
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
I had high hopes, given the many positive reviews. But either I had a bad unit, or the pump is just not powerful enough.

I got this to replace a 10 year old machine that was no longer pushing enough water through the espresso--either it was dirty or the pump was beginning to fail. However, the Mr. Coffee unit was slower and seemed to really hesitate to make my normal 2 shot espresso. So sadly, I returned it.
title: Not powerful enough
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
For the money, I think is the best espresso maker out there. It's a significant upgrade from the cheaper ones that do not have a real pump. The cheaper ones rely on heat and the boiler to drive the water through the coffee basket. The other upgrade with this machine is that the water tank is detachable, which means you don't have to turn the whole machine upside down to rinse out the tank, and this is definitely something you need to do sometimes with these machines. The machine produces a espresso shot with a layer of "creme" on top, as it should. This machine is priced at about a third of machines that usually have these features. In the past I've had high end Italian made machines.

On negatives, the steam wand does a lousy job of frothing milk and cream. The steam flow is weak. Do you want a Starbucks style froth? You're not going to get it. I don't use it. The directions say to use skim milk. Sorry, that doesn't cut it. I either drink an espresso shot, or I heat up a little half and half in the micro wave for my morning cappuccino.

The controls are strange. There's buttons on the face you have to press in certain order, and there is a dial on the side you have turn up an down, in a certain order. It's okay once you've completed the learning curve.

"Mr. Coffee" is a stupid name for an espresso machine, I think. Should be Signore Cafe.

I have the machine for six months and used if maybe five times a day, so it's holding up okay.
title: Good value for price.
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
This machine has made great espresso's, cappuccino's, and steamed milk for cocoas in all sizes for our family. They are all delicious. I love the control you have over the foam with the dial.

However, the milk tank is wretched. The tanks max fill like will get you roughly 2 double lattes. I HIGHLY recommend never filling it above the half way. The lid of the tank is not sealed or flat. When the milk splashes into the screw areas, around the nozzles and other connections it is extremely difficult to clean them. If you do not get every tiny splash of milk cleaned up your milk tank will sour incredibly quick ruining your next batch of drinks. Do not think that you can simply run a cleaning cycle and get rid of the flavor either. Grab your toothpicks, toothbrushes and get to work. While there are only 3 screws visible you cannot take apart the lid easily to clean inside of it. If you NEVER fill your tank above half you should be able to never run into this problem.
title: PITA to clean
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
Update Jul 24th - Almost 18 months, it still works perfectly. If it breaks, I would buy another one. Check below the secrets to keep it always new.
Update Mar 9th 2018 - After 13 months I'm still in love to our Mr. Coffee Espresso Machine. My wife also loves it. We have been using it every single day, at least 2 times a day, sometimes up to 6 times.

TIPS & SECRETS ==========================

Here are some SECRETS to keep your machine working, lasting longer and having more fun.
1- Use DISTILLED WATER to make coffee. Spring water is worst than water from your sink tap. More minerals on water, more metal residues on machine parts that will cause damage. Distilled water has no minerals. You can find it in a good grocery store. I buy mines on Wegmans.
2- CLEAN it. Always. Use the clean function after using froth milk, clean the water tank. Small milk of any other residues can damage any espresso machine within time.
3- Make MOCHA out of it, it's awesome. A good Chocolate syrup, whipping cream, added to the regular Cappucino. Cocoa power and some cinnamon powder.
4- Godiva's Chocolate liqueur on a cappuccino will add nice taste for hot weather.

5- Use the froth milk to make a fantastic Hot Chocolate, but before warm the cup and drop a square of a good dark chocolate on it.
6- Espresso is supposed to be very hot in temperature. Always warm the cup with boiling water if possible.
Update APR 5th - After almost 2 months It works perfectly, I simply love this Espresso Machine. The automatic milk foam feature is fantastic. I've bought cocoa powder, cinnamon powder, Hersheys Dark Chocolate Syrup, Godiva Cocoa Liquor and Whipped Cream to make some awesome special coffees.

FEB 9th 2017 - Loved ! I had a few Espresso Machines and decided for this after my older one burned on my fault. I just loved this machine, specially considering its price. Good espresso quality ! The Cappuccino and Latte features are awesome. Just the froth milk is a little bit watered. I make awesome mocha with it too. Really beyond my expectations. Let's nee its durability. Will be back to this review in 4 or 6 months. Feb/2017
title: Beyond my expectations !
bought_model: Color: WhiteStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: I've been using this thing pretty much everyday for the past 6 months and I finally feel that it's time for a review. During this period, I've finally been able to understand how to get the best out of this machine. When you use an inexpensive espresso machine, everything you do has to be perfect in order to get a good pour. From how fine your coffee grounds are, to making sure you have enough coffee in the pressurized baskets. Also just as important, tamping...make sure it's perfectly leveled and enough force put into it. That's the only way to get good coffee out of this thing. Once you get experience, you will be getting great tasting coffee in no time. I have noticed that the machine takes time to get the water at the right temperature, which is very important as well. I don't know if this has happened over time but I always have to switch it on and wait for about 40 minutes until it's prepared before I can make the coffee. Anyway, that's all there is to say about it. If you're buying this then you have to be prepared to put a lot more effort into making your coffee than you used to.
title: Preparation is key to getting the best out of this machine(6 months use)
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
Seriously. I'm not joking. I went to Italy for work, and they take espresso seriously, and I do as well, so when I came back to the states I wanted a machine that could make me a cappuccino automatically, and make decent, passable espresso.

It has a 15 bar pump, and its a semi-automatic espresso machine. I can't see a con with this machine. The espresso is good, the milk is thick and frothed well, and it has a water reservoir so you don't have to fill it every time.

Although the espresso is better from a real Cafe in Italy, this make stuff that is close. This isn't a 3000$ machine, its a 200$ machine that does everything you want it to. I use this thing 1-3 times a day, every single day, the water temp was is consistently accurate at 176.

TLDR: If you want to press a button and get a cappuccino, get this machine. You won't be disappointed. This exceeded my expectations (which is really hard to do). Probably the best purchase I've made of 2018.

Figuring that the third time would be the charm (no, no, no, no, no...) I tried again. The espresso was passable (I'm out of practice. My old machine died several months ago!), and the frother granted me an extra spurt....three this time, and I was even able to see a bit of steam wafting up from the stainless pitcher. And after only three spurts! I thought that quite remarkable!
At this point I decided it was best if Mr. Coffee and I parted ways and so I'm sending him packing. Adieu!

review_content:
For starters, as you read the reviews, you'll note some people reference the water reservoir leaking. Yup. It can happen. I played with it to see how bad the problem was, and it seems if the reservoir is moved from side to side a bit, the water begins to leak. Lifting the reservoir up and down didn't seem to cause that problem.

I knew of this potential going in to my purchase, and ultimately chose to keep it. Ours comes out for espresso or cappuccino and then gets put back in a kitchen cabinet, so we don't leave the reservoir filled, so there's really no scare of a leak. If you wanted to leave yours out and full all the time, you might consider the issue.

I was torn between 3 stars and 4 stars because of that issue, but ultimately gave this device 4 stars because of one simple factor:

It makes really incredible coffee... and is absurdly easy to use and clean. Heats up quick, the milk frothing feature works 100% as advertised (it's a very tight, solid fit... you have to giver the milk canister a good push to complete the seal... and it NEVER leaks). Literally scoop some espresso ground coffee in, tamp it down with the included scoop/tamper, point the milk nozzle inside your cup (if making a latte or cappuccino), push a button, and in seconds you have a fantastic cup of espresso, cappuccino or a latte.

review_content: We had purchased a $300 espresso machine, during the day to use for our family dinner before Christmas Eve last year, from a department store, by a major brand name. Had all off the recommended features, First machine made it through two cycles, both were very weak and not acceptable, then the pump failed and it peed all over the counter. Never made another cup. We went straight back to the store and got a replacement unit that only lasted most of the night. We then upgraded to a different manufacturer and paid over $400. This one made it  almost a week, before the pump failed. Took this one back and did not buy another one. This year, my wife suggested that I get a cheap unit just so she could have a latte at night. I bought this with a $30 gift certificate and took the slow freight ($9 out of pocket). You have to experiment with it a bit to get it just right to your taste, but it has been great for the espresso for the latte. We also found that it works better if you make the espresso, then put more water in and stream the milk as a separate operation. Just make sure you don't leave the coffee carafe in place or you will weaken your espresso. My wife was drinking a latte every night ($5) plus gas. Now she makes one when she wants it and we just use a pound of coffee every two weeks. Maybe the $1000 are better, but don;t waste your money on the $3-400 ones.
title: Cheap, but Effective.
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Several years ago I had received one of these as a gift. After less than a year of use it was not longer functioning. Because of my love of cappuccinos I decided to try again. I read all of the reviews for units that are sold on Amazon and decided that this machine was a good option. I did note that there were very polar reviews on all of the cappuccino machines, but this had the most 5 star reviews so I thought optimistically that I would try out this product.

I received this shipment on Friday and began happily making frothed beverages. Unfortunately, there were two instances when the froth only was produced and the espresso did not dispense, but with a quick reboot I was back on my way. However, it is now 5 days later and the unit has completely stopped functioning. I tried everything in the manual as well as contacting technical service for help, but they were unable to find a solution so the unit is being returned. You might get lucky and receive a functioning unit, but I have had 3 that have quit, so I will be going back to regular coffee.
title: Extreme disappointment
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
I never had an espresso maker before and this one is just fine for my purpose, which is just to make espresso; I'll probably never use the other features. The price was good for this sturdy little machine; it doesn't take up much room on the counter, and the flat top is ideal to store things. I experimented only twice with the amount of coffee required to make a (very) tasty cup; experimenting is necessary due to personal liking, and grind and type of coffee. The machine is quiet and fast. The more I use it, the more I like it.

There are some cons, for me anyway. The screw-on cap for the water reservoir is nice to look at, but is totally non-ergonomically shaped. It's almost impossible to get a good grip on it because of its sloped sides and smooth texture. The handle on the side to turn for "Steam" or "Brew" is very similar and difficult to use. I don't like these at all. I also don't like the lag time between cups because you have to wait awhile for the pressure inside the machine to drop before unscrewing the awkward cap. And super-lefties beware: the carafe MUST be poured with the right hand because of the placement of the little "V" in the carafe where the coffee is diverted to flow into a cup. I'm an ambidextrous lefty so it's not a problem, but the first time I tried to pour using my left hand, I saw this could be an issue for lefties.

All in all, I'm satisfied. I hope it lasts for awhile.
title: So far, so good
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: This is an excellent machine, but be aware it is NOT convenient. It is a LOT of work. For this machine to be worth the cost and trouble it involves, you would ideally be really committed (addicted) to fancy coffee and and in need of cutting down on expensive trips to your local Starbucks. If that is the case, and you are willing to follow religiously the many instructions for this machine's maintenance and use, it will deliver excellent, gourmet espressos and lattes very conveniently in your home.
title: The amount of hassle involved in using this machine is not for the faint of heart
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: I bought mine at Target but Amazon sells the same machine. This machine seems to have been designed and manufactured but never tested by anyone who had ever made espresso. There are two flaws in the design. First, the cup that holds coffee grounds is tapered towards the bottom so that a standard 49 mm tamper fits less than halfway down. If you don't fill the cup almost completely you can't adequately tamp down the coffee. A machine shop milled down my cast aluminum tamper for $10, so add that to the price you think you are paying for this machine. (Don't buy a stainless steel tamper; it's harder to mill.) Second, the holes in the basket are too large, so the water flows through the coffee too quickly. This makes a weak brew. A standard shot is 7g of coffee, but for me to get a decent single shot of espresso requires 10-11g, which fills the basket to the line marked 2 before tamping. That means spending half again as much on coffee beans, which will add up over time. The large holes also let too much finely ground coffee into my cup (I don't bother using the little carafe), creating sediment in the bottom. I could grind the beans more coarsely, but then the coffee would be even weaker. For 20 years I used a Swiss-made Krups steam powered espresso maker which was basically the same as this one, except without the design flaws, so I know how it should be. Alas, Krups now has their machine manufactured in China like every other company that sells these simple machines. It doesn't make sense to buy a $600 pump driven machine that takes a lot of care and feeding for 1 shot twice a day, so I'll use this one and hope it breaks soon so I can try again.
title: Design flaws make this machine expensive to use
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
It's hard to find a home espresso machine that has enough pressure to brew a decent cup of espresso. This is a solid machine and is low maintenance with a very easy learning curve.

The long list of Pros:
+ Large water reservoir
+ Easy to clean
+ Easy to use presets for espresso, cappuccino, and latte (single and double shots)
+ Adjustable milk/froth dial - can be changed while the machine is frothing
+ Easy to customize your drink beyond the presets (longer pull, amount of milk and froth)
+ Don't have to wait for the machine to cool down or lose pressure before making another drink - I always make at least two drinks (one for me and one for my husband). This is great if you have company and you don't want to be stuck at the machine forever.
+ Froths milk on its own - I hated having to do it myself with the wand on my old machine. I am really bad at it.
+ The temperature of the milk is good. I measured it at just under 160 degrees, the upper end of where you want it.
+ You don't have to buy pre-made coffee pods / you can use whatever coffee you choose
+ Comes with a scoop/tamper

The short list of Cons:
- Portafilter leaks after the machine stops brewing - If you turn the machine off, the dripping stops sooner.
- The milk frother works better on the first cup of coffee I make in a session (more milk and more froth). I'm not sure why, but maybe the machine has harder time when the milk level is lower.
- They should include a brush wand to clean the inside of the milk tube.
title: Very Nice Espresso Machine

review_content:
Amazon is great, this machine sucks. Within the same day I shipped this thing back, they are already processing my refund. Could write a drawn out explanation. But basically, I followed the instructions, wasted about 4 hours and almost a half bag of coffee trying to get this thing to work. It did work OK for lattes, but for cappuccinos, it did not froth, nor did it produce that beautiful crema on top of the espresso. I am usually a pretty handy gal and am good at troubleshooting, etc. I tried every setting, etc. Finally I called Mr. Coffee number and I couldn't even talk to a person, just like an automated troubleshooting recorder. They told me that I needed to clean it out with vinegar, run the cycle several times, then rinse with water. But the problem is it never worked, so surely it isn't already ready to be cleaned! I may have just received a defective one....I guess that happens. My patience was running too low and finally decided to return. I wanted it to work!!!!

However, if I were you my advice would be to continue researching and for not much more you can get a REAL espresso machine.

One suggestion I do have if you order this thing is don't start with the quick start guide. There is no quick start, so I don't know why they include it. You have to start by rinsing out all the pieces, then remove all the tape. THE BOTTOM OF THE WATER PITCHER HAS BRIGHT RED TAPE THAT IS ON THE BOTTOM THAT HAS TO BE REMOVED!!!! ALSO IN ORDER TO FUNCTION PROPERLY, THAT WATER TANK HAS TO BE AT THE MAX FILL FOR EVERY CUP, EVERY TIME. ALSO, THE MACHINE HAS TO BE PRIMED BEFORE OPERATING. DO NOT READ THE QUICK START, READ THE REAL MANUAL UPON OPENING.

Good luck!!! Mr. coffee, please come out with a higher end machine that actually does what the picture shows!

Update: I did more research and ended up getting the nespresso lattisima plus machine and it is amazing. It makes authentic latte macchiatos and cappuccinos. The cost is over 350, well money spent plus it comes with a free sample pack of capsules you can try for different strengths. And best part yet: no more coffee/espresso grinds all over your kitchen counters!

review_content: We can't seem to keep an espresso machine working for more than 1 year, so we decided to go with a little inexpensive model. And it always holds true, you get what you pay for, or in this case, maybe even less. The water reservoir doesn't hold enough water to brew the coffee AND foam the milk if you're trying to make two cappuccinos at a time. There is no control for the amount of steam - it's either off or on.  Anybody that really knows how to foam milk needs to be able to adjust and control the steam. And if you try to unscrew the water cap to add more water, you run the risk of being burned by the residual steam. Also there's no movement with the steaming wand which makes it harder to use. The basket assembly for the coffee grinds and the drip tray are very cheap. I don't know if this is returnable, but we won't be using it ever again.

review_content:
Update December 2012: When I first purchased this machine, I wasn't very happy with it as my below review reveals. However, since writing it 20 months ago, this espresso machine has provided me with daily lattes despite its issues. I'm revising my rating to give this little workhorse the credit it deserves. It's a great machine for the price, but don't expect years of service or to operate as the specs outline. I've found in the three espresso makers I've purchased, they last between 1-2 years. My current Mr. Coffee ECM160 is on its last legs, as the frother screaches more than froths the milk, even with daily cleaning, but I will be replacing my Mr. Coffee ECM160 with another just like it.

Review April 2011: I first purchased a DeLonghi EC155 Espresso Maker from Amazon about 14 months ago. The machine lasted for about a year and then just stopped working. But, during the time I had it, I became addicted to having a latte every morning, so when it died, I started looking for a replacement. I decided against purchasing another DeLonghi as the prices had increased significantly and it only lasted a year. Based on the reviewer ratings for the Mr. Coffee ECM160 4-Cup Steam Espresso Machine and the price, I decided to give it a try. Since receiving it around 2/25/11, the machine is prone to not brew the coffee and the frother never does the same thing twice. Sometimes when I turn the frother on, the steam starts immediately, other times, I have to wait for a few minutes and then this cannon of steam shoots out and makes a small explosion sound. In addition, sometimes I hear the water boiling for the coffee side of it and other times the water starts pouring as soon as I turn it to brew. It's my own fault for buying cheap chinese goods. I hope to keep you from making the same mistake unless you have money to burn.
title: Two Espresso Maker Reviews

review_content:
I am not an espresso connoisseur, but I love the espresso this machine makes. For the money, it's certainly gets the job done. It's got a small footprint, and it's incredible how fast the water is heated for pulling a shot.
I gave it five stars because of what it is. It's incredibly inexpensive and it makes, in my opinion, espresso every bit as good as a more expensive machine. The steamer takes a while to get milk up to temp, but again, you get what you pay for.
It's quick, efficient and easy to clean.
I have used this machine every day for more than a month, and though I can't be sure yet, it appears that with proper care it will last a very long time. I use the espresso for lattes, cappuccinos and iced lattes, and all come out delicious. I can't speak to a shot of pure espresso because I don't drink it that way, but I have no reason to think, for those who enjoy coffee that way, it would be good too, and probably has more to do with the bean than the machine anyway.
Absolutely thrilled with this purchase.

review_content: Great little machine. And because it's little there are a few things that it takes longer doing. It takes a while to heat up to brew and then takes a while to steam the milk.  However, once it does heat up and finish steaming the milk, it's a perfect latte. The steamer wand could be a bit longer but it's functional. I found that the coffee can't be tamped down too much because the machine isn't quite strong enough to force water through hard coffee (I used to be a barista so I was used to tamping the coffee down as hard as I could for a good strong brew). Just a little tap with a tamper works great.  I also learned that it's helpful to keep the reservoir full so that it doesn't run out of steam half way through steaming the milk...trial and error on that one.

title: I like this machine, not in love with it though.
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
If your looking to get a good cup of strong flavorful coffee..it's great.

However, I suggest that you use good quality freshly ground beans. As for an actual espresso with the sought after and coveted crema...don't expect it. I've tried everything to squeeze out the "crema" in the ground beans (and this machine)..and nada. I used the Safeway brand beans to a great quality locally roasted bean here (Coda) in the Denver area, and I still can't get it. I may have to resort to Illy or Lavazza and try those. Maybe it's this machine..or maybe it's me. I've gotten better results from an actual espresso pot than you can do over the stove.

BTW...the reason I bought this machine was that I burned up my espresso pot since I forgot to add water and all the plastic parts on it melted off. *sigh* I've had a few other espresso machines in the past 20 years..but I haven't had one for a while, so instead of replacing my burned up espresso pot, I bought this machine at Target for around 30 bucks.

The frothing wand is too short to really get down into the pitcher and the little black "perfect froth" attachment is useless, so I ended up tossing it alltogether and got slightly better results, but the wand is still too short. The carafe works fine to hold around 12 ounces of water (or more..a little more) but the silly lid can't hold on when you tilt it; it flys off and you have a mess on your hands, so I have to hold it on with my thumb while pouring.

It'll make a decent cappucino, but no great shakes. Again, since I'm missing the "crema" factor with this machine, I'm knocking off another point. But it will make great iced coffees.

The tamper that's built into the scoop is useless. Buy a decent metal one. Also buy a decent frothing pither that's not too deep or too shallow. I use a Bodum 2 cup french press carafe as my frothing pitcher, works pretty good actually.

SO.. if your looking for Italian cafe quality espresso with that great thick crema, don't look here. But If you want a decent cup of coffee with cream or a decent cappucino or iced coffee, it'll work for you hands down.

One side note, the electrical cord is too short for my taste, I know there's a wind-up feature on the bottom of the machine to make it as low profile as possible, but our kitchen doesn't have a lot of wall sockets, and I have to unplug another appliance to use this machine and my surface real estate is at a premium. In the future I am going to build out a wet bar/coffee bar and thus, install more electrical outlets. (In addition to my coffee making hobby, I'm also into mixology, so I figure I'll kill two birds with one stone)

But the future will have to wait...
title: For the money..it'll do its job..
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I am quite impressed by this machine! This is not my first espresso maker, I actually picked it up at the store after my DeLonghi began to malfunction soon after the warranty expired...
I bought the Mr Coffee on a whim, I just happened to notice the 15-bar sign on it while walking by and decided to give it a shot before forking another $250+ on a brand-name espresso machine.

In general, MrCoffee is great for brewing American-style coffee, but I've bought their espresso makers in the past and they all have been a huge disappointment. Not this one though! For the espresso drinkers - the quality of the espresso this machine makes will not disappoint you at all! Even the frothing function is superior to the much more expensive DeLonghi it replaced. This appears to be a true 15-bar machine and as such it makes great espresso, plenty of crema, fast to warm up, overall great buy for the price.

The only drawback - NOISY!!! Very, very noisy. You can wake up your kids for school by simply turning on the machine :) That's the only thing I will miss about the DeLonghi. But if you don't need a very quiet espresso machine, this one is an excellent buy!
title: Impressed

I'm going to have to buy one for myself!

So, I left it alone for a couple of hours, and found water pouring out the bottom of it.  I drained out all the water, and it smelled like it had been molding in the machine for months.  It was gross.  We did all the proper maintenance, including using the clean cycle after every latte. Sometimes, it would pump very little milk, and we would find clumps of milk.  But this time, it wasn't milk clumps, it just died.

review_content:
I rarely write reviews but I felt compelled to rave about this little espresso maker. I have spent probably $5K on coffee / espresso makers over the years. I bought various French presses, the Aero press, Cuisinart's, DeLongo's, etc. I was unhappy to some greater or lesser extent with all of them. None of them delivered and I gave them all away to family and friends.

I started the search again a few months ago and said "screw it" and bought this Mr. Coffee. That was abour 4 months ago and I can say without reservation that this is it! Small, powerful, and DELIVERS! Best of all it is very reasonably priced. It has reliably delivered evy morning for four months. More expensive is not better, folks. Get this machine and you will be very happy with it.
title: Seriously awesome
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
do not buy this product unless you only plan on using it a few times per year. I am an avid esspresso drinker (1+ per day) and have gone through 4 of these machines. They only last about 7 months during continual use. The pump goes out and gets really quiet while it drips about 1 drop per second. Customer service has replaced each one with a new one because of the 1year warranty, but don't count on it happing for you...they warned me it would be the last time they would replace it.

On the phone, they go through the whole when did you buy it, what is the number on the plug(this verifies the date of manuf.) did you de-lime it, are your grounds too fine....well duh, its an esspresso machine, of course the grinds are fine. I have starbucks or caribou grind the beans for an esspresso machine....way better than the stuff from a home grinder.

Anyways, mr coffee uses cheap pumps/parts and expects the average consumer to no use it enough in 1 year to require a replacment. Thats quality for you.

If you use coarse grinds, then this machine will be no problem for you....but your esspresso will be very watery.

come on mr coffee, use better parts!!!
title: poor quality parts, cheaply made, wont last longer than 7months

bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Had this for 2.5 weeks. The milk frother gets clogged super easily and quickly even though i clean it right afterward. It just takes too long since you can pull espresso and steam like right after. you still have to wait for your milk to steam for a long bloody while (160 is the standard cause 140 is warm). tamper sucks. doesn't come with a pitcher. filters are too damn small, even for a double shot. you basically need to buy a stainless steel tamper and the RIGHT size pitcher (12oz)... otherwise the wand won't reach. there are too many accessories you have to buy along with it as if you're not already paying a more than $50. as for me though, i'm really impatient (but not willing to ruin quality so i'll never get a kcup machine) and this.... is so slow by the time you have to switch brewing to steaming. I know the starbucks rule is a shot cant be left for longer than 10 seconds which is probably something they made up for promptness but since it takes about more than 50 seconds for my milk to even go to 140-160 the shot is ruined. i was hoping to find a good budget machine but now i feel like i need to consider Breville Barista express because my drinks take too long to make. Should've figured that. Oh well. On to the next one.
title: Too much time waiting.

review_content:
IN ORDER TO MAKE A DOUBLE CUP THAT IS STRONG ENOUGH FOR ME I USE THE LARGER COFFEE HOLDER,DONT FILL THE CUPTO MUCH,AND USE A STRONGER QUALITY EXPRESSO BREW.

Ordered from ereplacementparts.com for the particular model.  Clip at least 1/2" too short to reach filter cup.  Called Mr. Coffee.  They offered the same exact replacement part!  You'd think the manufacturer would have the correct replacement part.  Since unit was under warranty, they shipped a whole new unit.  Good service, and hopefully I won't break the clip this time!

I ended up buying a small stove top espresso maker.  Now for the other problem.  I am right handed and the steam wand is on right side as is the dial.  It is awkward to hold cup and operate on/off for steam.  Better design would have the switch in front or on left side
title: Needs redesign
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
Honestly I would rather give this machine a 2.5 instead of 2 stars and this is why. I suspect that this is not a pressurized system rather a cheap steam/hot water espresso maker because a decent pressurized system would leave a hot and dry puck instead of a muddy mess in the portafilter. Also, when tamping my grinds it feels as if the handle is going to separate from the portafilter holder. I cant see this handle lasting very much longer.

Another problem is the milk frother. This just doesn't froth milk at all. Like other accounts this frother really just blows bubbles of hot milk into your cup and on your counter top and all over your machine which is visible being its black.

The espresso itself is OK at best. Kind of watery.

Other reviews claim this thing burns out quickly which I hope happens to mine so I have an excuse to get rid of it.

review_content: I recently purchased this unit to replace another great espresso maker that broke. This unit is extremely disappointing compared to the (cheaper) one I had before. There is no way to heat the water before you brew so you're stuck with brewed coffee instead of steamed coffee-which is what makes espresso espresso. When you follow the instructions in the manual and wait for the initial "brewing" of the coffee and then turn it to steam, all the unit does is shoot out a stream of water from the steamer. The plastic used is very cheap-during my first assembly of the unit out the of the box, the portafilter handle broke off. This thing is an utter waste of money. Its an expensive, 8 oz regular coffee maker and for the price, there are much better espresso makers that make actual ESPRESSO.
title: Waste of money
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I bought this with a gift card, it was the only one available within the price range at target..

This does pretty much what it advertises, but just not quite as good as it should. My issues do not arise from not including a tamper or frothing pitcher. They arise from the fact that it seems the company has not actually used this product.

The frothing wand leaves much to be desired. You can not get a good microfoam on the milk, especially not with the frothing "aid" attached. It would be much nicer to have a bit more room to work with on the wand, it is too close to the body of the machine. The IMUSA machine seems to have a much better solution to this (and at the same price). I have not used it though, so i cant say for sure. Another reviewer did suggest putting a foam attachment onto the wand, which seems like a good idea, but where would one find this type of foam? i would like to know! The back of the coffee scoop is supposed to act as a tamper, however, since it has rounded sides it fails miserably. If it were made with a completely flat bottom, with 90 degree sides, it would be A LOT more useful. These are simple things, that could be fixed without increasing the price.

The switch between brewing and frothing can be a bit tricky to get down. How i have done this is i put a bit more water (at the mid line of the metal ring around the pitcher) in when i am getting ready to brew, and stand by the machine as it brews. Once the pitcher fills to the 4 cup line, i switch to frothing. I dont think this could be fixed without increasing the price, so no points off, but it is still a bit of a hassle. If you dont measure it correctly, you have to refill the reservoir, and wait for it to heat up the extra water before you can continue frothing/steaming. Then if you put too much in (as in, the amount suggested on the pitcher), you will need to grab a glass of water to release the extra pressure before you use it to brew again.

Overall, the product does what is advertised, but HOW it performs the tasks could be improved.
title: An "OK" Product
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Ok, first I want to start by saying, I wish my husband would have purchased this machine through Amazon. I told him is would be much cheaper than where he purchased it to surprise me.
Once you go through the start up process (Do Not Skip This Process), which was not time consuming, this machine is quick and easy to use.
I made my first caramel latte in less then five minutes. I'm always on the go and do not have the money or time to always stop by Starbucks. I can easily set this machine up to brew, walk away to grab my keys and purse, come back, grab my cup and go! I pre grinded the beans last night though to speed things up in the morning.
I hope this helps! If you do purchase it... Enjoy!
If you are debating on the price and going through the reviews of all the machines, you seriously need to consider this one. I hope in a year I still feel the same about this machine. For now, I just made my favorite latte in my pajamas!!!
title: Never Have To Go To Starbucks Again!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Bought at Target for $30. I just use it to make iced coffee - Americano style. The steamer doesn't really work in my opinion. Tried it out and it didn't create a froth at all. However, I'm not using it for the steamer, so whatever. With standard coffee makers, brewing coffee and then pouring it over ice never tastes good; always sour and bland. I just use strong roast store-bought coffee and make about 5 shots of espresso with this machine each morning; pour it over ice, add some half/half, and stevia and it tastes great. Also, you don't need a tamper. The scooper this thing comes with will do the trick. Just use the back of it to press the coffee grounds down into the metal filter. People complaining that you MUST have a tamper need to chill. It's really not that scientific.
title: Great for making iced coffee

review_content: There is nothing like a latte and buying them out all the time can break the bank that's for sure.  I thought I would give this a try since I have had the old version of the Mr. Coffee Latte machine for quite some time and enjoyed it.  This Barista is totally awesome let me tell you.  Making your coffee and having the milk froth up and go into the coffee without having to do a dozen steps is so cool.  I need my jolt in the morning and this gives me just what I want and need without a big fuss and break the bank feeling.  It's so easy to use and easier to clean.  I have to say Mr. Coffee is really keeping up with the compatition and this is a great machine for a portion of the price of many others and you get as good if not a better quality drink.  I can't wait to try and make a Iced Latte as those are my most favorite.  The instruction booklet comes with some really neat recipes too and I have tried a couple of them and loved them.  This will give me many years of what I love and need the most....Coffee!!!

review_content:
I was a little hesitant to order this at first, since I'm definitely not the coffee-connoisseur/ barista type, but the more hooked I got on a major chain's iced latte, the more convinced I became to try it. No regrets at all! I'm glad I didn't shell out for a much more expensive model. For me, it's perfect. I had my first 2 cups of cappuccino in under 30 minutes today, out of the box. My boyfriend wanted another, and once I had the hang of it, it probably took about 3 minutes to made another cup. I did notice that I needed to add a little more water to the reserviour after brewing to get adequate steam for frothing. The rubber tip on the steamer is my only concern- it doesn't look too sturdy, and I'm not sure how long it will hold up. One more note: I followed the directions for 2 cups, and it made a little less. I will tweak the amounts of ingredients next time. Overall, very happy with this money-saving purchase!

Pros:

Low cost
No need to buy disposable coffee filters
Not loud (with the exception of frothing)
Easy to clean
Fast brewing

Cons:
Doesn't come with a steaming pitcher (I used a measuring cup for now) or tamper (bottom of included coffee scoop works fine)
title: Great lattes, great bargain!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: I have had a number of home espresso machines.  Braun, Krups, Mr. Coffee.  But this is the first pump machine I've had.  Excellent functionality, and much better espresso than any of the previous machines.  Someone who knew nothing about espresso would be able to tell the improved quality of the espresso.  Crema was nonexistent with the others.  I use high quality beans and grind them just before brewing.  Excellent function.  Loses a star because of the removable water tank- presents an opportunity for a leak but provides no benefit, and because it combines push-button and knob use to make espresso or steam.  This is redundant, either should suffice alone.  Great machine.  Too early to determine durability.  To date, the average life span of an espresso machine in my heavy-use environment is 2 years.  We shall see.

review_content:
I received this machine as a gift in advance of a family get-together. Said family member who gifted it is a self-admitted espresso addict, so expectations were high that this machine could perform as well as her $300 machine back home. And for around $30 you're probably as skeptical as we were. But skeptics will be delighted.

No, this doesn't make an authentic espresso or latte, but it makes a pretty darn close beverage for a fraction of the price. The espresso addict and the former barista family members were very pleased with the ease of use and the end result. When the coffee addict's $300 machine at home broke after a couple of years of use, she bought one of these to replace it.

It doesn't come with a tamper or a frothing pitcher, and in my honest opinion, neither are needed. We just steam and froth the milk in the cup we're going to drink out of, then add the brewed coffee in. I've always found you tend to waste an obscene amount of milk with a frothing pitcher anyway. We just have a 12oz glass mug, about 1/3 we fill with milk, steam and froth away...then add the coffee in on top. For a tamper, save $14 and use an appropriately sized spice jar from your cupboard.

Ours has been going through multiple uses a day for nearly 8 months without a problem thus far. My only complaint is the plastic frother doohickey is useless and just makes more hassle to clean things up. You don't need it to get a good froth, just play with it a few times and you'll get the knack of frothing.

For around $30 you can't go wrong!
title: Excellent for the price!

review_content:
Arrived today, 4/7/2017. Read reviews about milk never coming out the spout. After following the instructions to a "t" the espresso poured beautifully but no milk came out. After a bit of troubleshooting, I realized that there was no mechanism for the milk to go up from the reservoir to the frothing component. After some digging, we found reference to what amounts to a silicone straw that was missing from our package that goes in the reservoir. Additionally, instead of one single- and one double-shot basket, we received two single-shot baskets. We will be calling customer service in the morning for replacement parts. Three stars for now. Will update review after parts are received and the machine is functional.

Update 4/8/2017: Called Mr. Coffee at 1-800-672-6333. After some frustration with the robot AI, I finally got to speak to a representative. Hint, just say "representative" and it will get you over to someone. The rep was quick and professional. He shipped the silicone tube and double shot basket to us; I didn't even have to prove that I had purchased it by providing the model number etc. He stated it should get to us by 2-3 business days. So far, excellent customer service.

Will update after parts arrive and we can actually test it. We also purchased a Mr. Coffee grinder along with this espresso system, and will be reviewing that as well.
Mr. Coffee Automatic Burr Mill Grinder with 18 Custom Grinds, Silver, BMH23

Update 4/14/2017: We received the replacement part on Wednesday, exactly 3 business days and 5 days total after I contacted customer service. Unfortunately, it was the wrong part. We received the "frothing tube" instead of the "silicone tube." Naturally I forgot to call before work yesterday, so I called this morning. I'm downgrading my review based on this interaction. Firstly, in my original call, they did not order me both parts requested and obviously because they ordered me the wrong part. Secondly, during this call, upon hearing that the double shot filter was not in stock, and the machine was therefore unusable, I was told to ship the entire machine back to Mr. Coffee to receive a whole new machine. And to call back within 48 hours... I cut her off there. Considering that I have two single shot filters that I can use in the meantime, this was outrageous. More time and effort over a machine that I purchased brand new and have yet to use. Moreover, it took considerable restraint and perseverance on my part to get the customer service representative to actually locate the correct missing part to make the machine usable, the silicone tube, despite my telling her that I had located it on the replacement website and it was in stock, and that I had the model number in front of me during the call. She had me get up and look at the metal prongs on my coffee machine to give her the code etched there prior to her taking the model number. Then when she found the part, and I asked her to tell me the name of the part that she was ordering (for confirmation) she told me the wrong part! I had to correct her. Hands down the worst customer service experience I have had in a while for a machine that came to me missing parts. I really hope this is all worth it, because we really are excited to use this machine.

Update 4/19/2017: We purchased the double shot filter over Amazon, it got here yesterday. We got the shipping confirmation for the silicone tube... It was shipped 6-8 business days. Ordered 4/14, shipped 4/18, then we'll get it 6-8 business days. The first time I called they shipped it 2-3 business days... Only the wrong part. Ridiculous. Had the machine narly 2 weeks and haven't been able to use it, and it'll be another week before the part I asked for arrives. Cannot recommend at this point.
title: Missing parts
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: I recommend this steam machine without hesitation. I'm using illy when I feel rich but it even makes lavazza/other inexpensive espresso taste good; great crema. Initially I was  disappointed at the foaming capability (my #1 reason for making coffee drinks) b/c the volume didn't double. What I found was that the foam is stiff, stays foamy for a long time, has a wonderful texture even when using 1/2 and 1/2. With other foaming devices there's usually a noticeable difference with skim milk foaming the best. No so with this one even almond milk foams fabulously. Do follow the directions but it's not confusing, cleanup is easy.

It vibrates so much that the cup moves out of position spilling the coffee into the catch basin rather then the cup.  The water heats up quicker is the only difference. It's not a snug fit in the filter, but it's close enough to give a good tamping. For our general use, this machine is a very good value.

This part has been quite disappointing within a few months of ordering it, I also ended uo taking the warranty from square trade and I would like for them to look into it or have it replaced

review_content: Okay, I did get this item just a few months ago. Worked great, easy clean up, easy setup, great coffee. Then I went to turn it off, the switch literally just came off in my hand. I did not force it, I just went to turn the knob and it plopped off, could not stick it back in, nothing. I would not get this product. The switch broke internally and you really cannot get to it.
title: Power knob breaks off after a few months of use
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Makes ok cafesito, "loved the steamer while it worked" that was the whole reason for the purchase, it did not last long, the steamer stopped working in three months, the coffee maker side works ok but not the steamer side, mind you I empty it after every use not to keep it with preassure inside.
I would not buy this again, my ten bucks cook top coffee maker do just as good if not better cafe cubano and without the steamer for the milk it is way over price.

Revised 01/10/14 from above post.

After a tip from TwiligtStar my steamer/foamer is back to working. Apparently my way of cleaning the wand was not good enough. I was letting some steam out after I was done foaming as he suggests and was also using a cup of water with Dawn detergent to foam up and clean it after every use, it's not enough it still got clogged. I unscrewed the tip and cleaned both the wand and tip, a thin wire for the wang and a needle on the tip, runned a full load of steam and I'm back in bussiness.

What can I say, foammmmmyyyy cafe con leche and my morning cigar just gloooorrriiioooouuuussss.

I would now recomend this unit with the mindset that you have to pay extra attention to the cleaning and care of the wand.
title: Great Espresso/Foamer machine if...
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: I have had 2 conversations with the manufacturer.  First machine - I followed setup instructions line by line and then made several cups of coffee both lattes and cappuccinos (all doubles) as I like good strong coffee.  The cappuccinos are supposed to yield 10 ounces at double and the lattes are supposed to yield 15 ounces at double.  The cappuccinos only produced about 6 ounces including the froth height and the lattes only produced about 8 ounces including the froth height.  Customer service said I should be getting what the booklet said; so they sent me another.  Same thing with the second.  I called them again.  Again they said I should get what the booklet said; so they sent me the third machine.  I am disappointed, the third machine same results.  This time I simply made a DVD of the machine to show them the results.  I don't think I would get 3 defective machines in a row.  It simply does not produce the amount it claims.  The only redeeming point is that the cappuccinos and lattes taste great when I use very good quality of coffee and ground espresso grind.  They either need to modify the programming or the pump or change their claim on the amount.
title: Only produces half a cup per booklet claims
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Wife bugged me to buy this after she saw the price of the unit.  My family and friends all use Keurig and Delonghi but after I read reviews and saw many videos about this product I was convinced this was a VERY good buy because we like to use our own beans and like to know what we are putting into our drinks vs some sealed pods.  Every cup has come out perfect like art and have exceeded my expectations coming from such a small price for such a big hit at our home for parties and gatherings!  Yes, our pod/ k-cup purchases halted after buying this machine and we will never go back.
title: Exceeded my expectations especially for the price!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: This machine replaced my previous Mr. Coffee expresso maker which had slowed down to the point that it took 30 minutes to het up.  This maching is many steps up.  It makes expresso, capucinno, and latte's and has a cleaning mechanism built in. Sort of a Rube Goldberg device in that it blinks and whistles.  I doubted that it would work or last, but a month later its still brewing strong.  It looks complicated,  but it doesn't take long to get the hang of it, and the result is a good amount of froth, and decent expresso in about 10 minutes. Not as strong as I would like, maybe need to try different brand of expresso.  You can adjust the froth level but takes some time to get it right.  If your froth accidently spills over, you should take out the drainage trays and wash out everything; otherwise, you will regret it a few days later as I did.  Its a good buy for the moderate cost, and fun.  It will pay for itself. in no time/

I have tried turning it back on for a few days in a row, but it is still totally dead.  Apparently I cannot return this item through Amazon at this point, so I will attempt to do so through the company itself. However, I thought it was important to warn people that this has been an issue for me, as the product was very highly rated when I purchased it.
title: I purchased this coffee machine in November. In March ...

review_content: I'm not one to write reviews,  but let me tell you that this Barista Espresso maker is amazing! I have never been all that great making espresso, much less cappuccinos nor lattes, but with this bad boy I am the house Barista and make delicious espresso, cappucinos and lattes! It's so easy to use and to clean. Anyone having a hard time with this might have not fully read through the instructions..... it is VERY important to prep the machine and then of course make sure your milk reservoir is pushed ALL the way back, or all 3 buttons will not light up. You will be a pro in no time! I even purchased a new clear mug set to showcase my delicious creations when family or guest come over..... I can't say enough about this wonderful machine..... love, love, love it - I would give it 10 stars if I could ‚ô°
title: Don't think about it, just GET IT!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
My steam-based espresso maker blew out -- probably my fault. I'm not a real coffee snob but I'd heard that pump-based machines produce a much more authentic drink and picked the Mr. Coffee based on quite reasonable price and decent comments. I've only had it for a week but so far I'm very happy. The espresso has a nice crema, which the old machine didn't really provide. The frother is decent, though it really whistles when it's deep in the cup. Like others I've had some trouble with the filter being very stiff to lock and unlock. Hoping it will ease up. The machine seems to be solidly built; I'll try to remember to update after a year or so. I kind of miss the 4-cup carafe of the old one but it seems they're only used in the steam machines. Overall, a big thank-you to Mr. Coffee. Time to experiment with fancy beans.
Update: Works fine after 6 months. I use it several times a week, much more often than the old one.
title: A step up
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: I just received my new Mr. Coffee espresso maker and so far so good! I decided to go with a bag of Starbucks espresso roast however I'd like to try the Illy medium roast eventually as well. The espresso maker is easy to use and makes great espresso, my crema turned out perfect. I think the only negative thing I have to say about the machine is that it's a little noisy and I'm also getting soupy grinds after I make my espresso. I'm not sure if I'm tamping the coffee too much and it's causing it trouble or what the deal is. I think this may be user error :) But other than that I absolutely love it! My recommendation would be to go ahead and buy the little espresso cups as well as a milk frothing pitcher while you're at it. The drip tray is removable and you can fit a normal size mug down under there however I think it's nice to not have to remove the drip tray since some water may come out when you are finished frothing your milk. I also went ahead and removed the rubber cap on the end of my frother and it's made no difference in its ability to froth but it has made it much easier to clean. I read a lot of reviews that stated the machine only hade a lifespan of a year or two but really for the price I paid then I'm ok with that, I wouldn't mind replacing it should something happen to it. It takes me about 10 minutes to make a cappuccino, but I'm pretty slow at it as well so I'm not sure, as time goes on I may get quicker at it. I'm also using a little flavored Torani syrup in my nonfat milk when I fix cappuccinos and they turn out yummy. So overall I'd definitely recommend this machine, if a newbie like me can make a good cappuccino then anyone can!

review_content: I received this machine as a very sweet and thoughtful gift from a friend.  I loves me my coffee and espresso and work part time at Starbucks to support my habit, but have always wanted a espresso maker at home.  This machine is horrible.  The espresso it made was ok, not too bad, but sometimes it took as long as five minutes to spit out the espresso.  Often times I would sit there and wait for something to happen, turn it off, turn it on, turn it off again, wait, turn it back on, and so on before it would work.  And forget about frothing the milk.  It worked for one day for me, and I was foolishly thrilled that I could make frothed milk at home until it stopped working. Then I was sad.  Now all I get are sad little bubbles. and the milk doesn't even heat up at all. My Tassimo does a better job 'frothing', and that doesn't say too much. Not to mention I try to steam the milk with the frothing aid and it sucked up the milk into the water reserve, and when I tried to make expresso the next time around It came out milky.  AND you can't use espresso pods in the machine because the pressure is too weak.  And yes, the electric cord is freakishly short.  We're talking like three or four inches.  The only plug in my kitchen where it will reach is right next to the sink and I freak out every time electrocuted.  So, in short, I will be stuck with this machine because I do not want to hurt my friend's feelings, but if you want to buy a espresso machine either shell out the money for a real one or at the very least spend the extra 30 bucks to get a higher quality machine NOT from Mr. coffee.
title: I work at Starbucks and know my espresso-this aint it

review_content:
PROS:
-- Super easy to setup and use.
-- Love the water reservoir so that I don't have to worry about refilling it every time I use it.
-- Also, after you turn it on, it takes virtually no time for it to be ready to start brewing (maybe less than 1 minute) or for the frothing arm to be ready to steam.
-- You can also use the machine to heat up water really fast if you want to make tea and don't wanna buy an electric kettle (although kettles actually boil the water in the same amount of time)
-- You can use the frothing arm to warm up coffee or milk if you don't want to froth, since it releases hot steam
--I was considering getting the more expensive $150 version (ASIN: B007K9OIMU) but a friend got it and it broke down fairly quickly (it seems that the pump has issue drawing milk from the reservoir) so I decided to play it safe and get this one for half the price of the more expensive version. On the plus side, with this one you can control exactly how much milk you can froth or heat.

Minor cons:
-- The frothing arm could be a little longer, some frothing pitchers are tall and if you just want to froth/warm up a little bit of milk, the arm won't reach down too far so you have to fill up the pitcher with more milk than you'll use, which is a waste.
--- You have to twist the filter basket really hard to get it to lock, which bring concern with durability (the basket is stainless steel but the locking mechanism in the espresso machine might be of a softer material that could wear out over time, especially if you make coffee several times a day). Only time will tell (I'll update this review if anything comes up).

My review isn't so much about the units performance but rather the description of the item. Bought this item as an open box "Used - Like New - Item has no cosmetic scratches or blemishes. Item has no cracks or dents. Item will come in original packaging. Packaging may be damaged. All accessories are present and undamaged."

No big deal right? Wrong. I opened the box and found that the item was previously used - looked liked moderate use to me, not Like New. I saw the cosmetic damage that wasn't described such as scratches and a dent near the control panel. Most of product was covered in water spots, including the inside milk and water containers. The cup plate had scratches and scuffs - Which was not in the product description. Some of the parts had some minor ware on it as if it was used several times. The instruction manual had water damage as well. In my opinion would rate the package/unit i got "Used - Good" conduction not "Like New." That being said I took about 30 minutes cleaning up the unit and ran the machine though the cleaning cycle and all made some espresso and the unit worked fine.

The unit itself functioned and did what it was suppose to do. If i was to rate the unit it would get 4/5 stars, amazon description gets a 1/5. I know you take a certain risk with open box products, I've never had an issue with any retailer honestly with open box. I've purchased them before along with refrubs items and never got anything like this.

review_content:
I have several cautions for extending the life of this machine:
1. I replaced 3 ECMP50 coffee makers until I watched a few YouTube video clips and realilzed what DESCALING involves and thought I'd add a few words to those mentioned below. The scaling takes place in the heat exchange unit internal to the machine. You don't see it. If you don't regularly descale your ECMP50, the metal seals in the heat exchange unit will clog, split and ultimately leak ... the cause for my 3 replacements. To avoid this problem, add descaling to your calendar about once a month. The directions are OK in the manual although I use a regular descaler rather than vinegar. The gunk that comes out tells me it is helping.
2. The only other leak (unless something is seriously defective) arises if you steam milk and forget to empty the overflow tray at the front of the machine.
3. The frothing tip is made of LIGHTWEIGHT ALUMINUM and WILL STRIP after you remove and reinstall it several times. Consider buying a replacement 1-hole tips to have it ready when needed. Clean the tip after frothing. Steam into your container filled with water and then wipe down the tip. If you don't remove it, it will be unlikely it will strip.
title: I have several cautions for extending the life of this ...
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
My husband and I bought this espresso maker in September of 2012. For the first year, he wasn't making more than one espresso a week on average. Sometimes more, sometimes less, but I'd say one per week is probably about right.

But late last year, in the winter of 2013, I became addicted to espresso. He taught me how to use the machine so that he wouldn't have to make one for me. I was having one almost every day.

In June or July 2014, I can't remember exactly when, I noticed that water was all over the kitchen counter after running the machine. That was the beginning of the end.

I put off buying a new machine by just folding kitchen towels underneath the espresso maker before running it. That catches most of the water. Unfortunately, though, the machine is also losing pressure and the espresso isn't dripping out the same. Also, it's annoying to have to dry soaking-wet towels EVERY time I want an espresso. I'm cheap, but I'm not that cheap. I knew it was time.

I finally gave in and purchased a new espresso maker. Which one? The same one as before: the Mr. Coffee ECMP50.

Now I acknowledge that this machine has a pump defect and that 1-2 years of shelf life with regular use is probably the most I'll ever get out of it, but as far as I can tell from the reviews of other machines in this price range, pump problems are common. If not a pump problem, then they all have their other issues, so I can take my pick.

If you're buying this espresso maker, it's because you want something more than the "non-espresso espresso makers" that are really just brewing strong coffee (and cost half the price), but you're not looking to drop $500-1000 on a professional unit. If that's you, then this one is as good as any. The espresso is delicious, the machine is basic and very easy to use, and although you'll have to buy another one in a year or two, that's probably true of a lot of these cheaper models.

So before you buy, ask yourself if you'd rather spend a lot of money up front for something higher quality that'll last longer and has more features OR if you'd like an introductory machine that makes delicious espresso that's much more affordable, but will need to be replaced much sooner. I opted for the latter.
title: Affordable basic espresso maker that will need to be replaced after a few years
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
This is my first coffee machine. I don't drink coffee, but cappuccinos looked so good I had to buy this to see if I could at least enjoy coffee substitute cappuccinos.

It didn't take long to learn how to use this machine. It froths milk and almond milk very well and delivers great tasting herbal (coffee substitute) drinks. Clean up is very fast. Here are some suggestions for use:

1. If your milk container won't push on all the way, the rear o ring on the machine behind the milk dispenser needs to be shaved down so it is not so thick. Remove it with a small hook and shave the outside of the ring SLIGHTLY with small scissors and then put it back on. I gave the machine only 4 stars because end users should not have to modify the machine this way to get it to work properly.

2. Leave the Porta Filter in place for awhile before removing it. This allows liquid to drain from the puck so it is dry enough to dispose of without making a wet mess in the garbage can. If water does not drain, you can open the Porta Filter slightly to break the pressure seal and then it will drain.

3. Use the flip up retension lever on the Porta Filter handle to hold the metal filter in place when smacking it against the inside of your trash can to quickly empty the filter without losing the filter itself in the trash too. (I only mention this because the instructions didn't tell me what the retension lever was for and I had to figure this out).

4. Don't use herbal coffee substitutes that clog the filter. The instructions say this will ruin the machine. Ayurvedic Roast Original French Vanilla is one example that should not be used with this machine. Teeccino Mediterranean Herbal Coffee Vanilla Nut works just fine. So does New Life Coffee Substitute (if you like the soy flavor).

5. For the most froth, I put the steam-froth dial 2/3 of the way toward the froth setting, not all the way.

6. Leave the milk spout pointed out towards the cup always. It's too easy to forget and start a cappuccino with the spout pointed straight down, and then you have no small cleanup. I store and carry the milk container to and from the refigerator in a bowl with the spout in dispensing position. It is very convenient to manage this way.

7. I put both metal filters that came with the machine upside down on my drill press and widened the bottom hole with a 1/16 inch drill bit being careful not to push through the microfilter plate below the hole. Whether this affects pressure and final flavor, I don't know. What I do know is that the bottom hole and the inner chamber behind it are much easier to keep clean.

I like this machine. I'm glad I bought it. The drinks it makes taste better than what I can make heating water on the stove, so there must be something to the pressurized water passing through the grounds in the right amount of time. Now that I have tasted the difference, I am a believer in these machines.
title: Works very well
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
This is my second Mr. Coffee Caf√© Barista. My family uses the Barista four or five times everyday and for it's price, can't be beat.

Obviously, it doesn't compare to a machine costing 10 or 20 times as much, but it get's close. Other reviews complain about the inconsistent foam or steam, but this is a minor inconvenience easily remedied by a double extraction or regular cleaning. In fact, I find the consistency of this machine far better than my local Starbuck's barista. Daily cleaning per the instructions is important, which I plead inconsistency. If you don't clean daily, however, you can still run a monthly vinegar cleaning and get the machine back to normal operations.

One note regarding my second machine, if the extraction does not conform to the brown "la crema" or the latte steam is not hot enough, you may have a defective machine. As I knew what to expect, my second machine was obviously not operating correctly. I called the service line and they replaced my machine with no questions asked.
title: Best value, fully automated latte/capuccino machine available.
bought_model: Color: RedStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
I really like this machine. It does exactly what I wanted and it is easy to use.

For context, I'm not a coffee expert or connoisseur. I wanted a machine that made a decent espresso (with higher pressure than your typical pod machine) and gave me options on which coffee I used for a reasonable price. Plus, mostly, I make lattes and cappuccinos. This machine does all this very well. You can control the amount of "foam" in the milk, plus you can control how much coffee is mixed in. It is not as convenient as the pod machines but it makes way better coffee and specialty drinks. For comparison, I had a machine that you could put in the milk pod then the coffee pod to make the drink - it worked well and was easy to clean. But, the results were not as good and the coffee and milk was much more expensive - plus I was limited to the few vendors that sold coffee for it. This machine makes way better drinks (lattes!), at a much lower cost. Only down side is that the cleanup is a little more work, although I'm much more comfortable that this machine is "clean" as all areas are easy to get to (as opposed to the other machine where there are a bunch of hidden areas that need cleaning that are not obvious, thus you may be less sanitary overall).

For the price and result, in particular for my needs, I'm very happy.

review_content: I bought this product for my girlfriend as a birthday gift. In addition to the espresso machine, I bought a 12 ounce frothing cup, 49mm tamper, frothing thermometer, and a Capresso coffee burr grinder model 559. BOTH OF US COULD NOT BE HAPPIER!!! Within my second try, I produced lattes that rival the best we have ever had! I am using Starbucks espresso beans, and grinding them on a fineness setting of "4" on the Capresso grinder. I can not give this machine enough praise! It is quiet running, the frother works like a charm, and within about 2 minutes I am completely finished making my latte. Hopefully this machine stands the test of time, but even if I would only get a couple months out of it, it would still be worth every penny. I highly recommend this machine in combination with the accessories mentioned. With a couple Youtube video's under your belt, you'll be well on your way to saving money and making some amazing espresso!

review_content:
I have owned this machine 2 times. Both times, the machine quit working exactly after approximately 2 years, with two times use everyday. I did not use the frother, instead I usually use the aerolatte, which works nice after you warm the milk in microwave. I clean the machine usually after a month or 2 usage. Even then, the machine stops working, even after I clean with water, vinegar, etc. multiple times. Yes, it is OK for the price and makes good coffee latte and espresso, but not long lasting.

I have bought Mr. Coffee Baristo maker - will see if it is any better! Expensive though compared to this.
title: Average functionality.
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
It worked great for about 6 months. Now, the seal between the chamber holding the coffee grinds and the machine no longer seals properly and a LOT of steam escapes during the brew process. I guess it paid for itself since I avoided Starbucks for 100-200 shots of espresso, but I expected it to last a bit longer.

Good: it was cheap ($39)
Bad: it was not usable anymore after 6 months.

I'm going to spring for a more expensive unit that has a better reputation here next time.

Edit: Before tossing it, I decided to try "repairing" it. Flipping the unit upside down, I noticed the rubber seal that was failing to hold in the steam between the machine and the brew chamber was no longer seated correctly. It's held in place by a steel screen held on by a single screw. I removed that screw with a philips screwdriver, washed the rubber gasket, reseated it, and screwed the steel screen back down to hold it in place. The unit now works again. I've updated my rating from 2 to 4 stars. It would be nice if there was a place to buy replacement gaskets, but I've been unable to find them online.

Best,
