Now I have to hope Amazon will doing something about it because I only was able to use it twice.
title: I thought this was wonderful until the little rubber ring that holds the frothing ...
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I realized I was spending a fortune on lattes so I did A LOT of reseach about espresso makers. I am a student so I couldn't afford much so for the price I think this espresso machine is great! I didn't order it off of Amazon though, I actually went to Walmart because they have a 1 yr replacement plan for $3 and I wanted it right away! I looked at a lot of other people's reviews first and decided that I might as well give it a try for 36.44 (Walmart price) it was worth the risk and if something breaks Walmart sends another one in a couple of days. READ THE DIRECTIONS FIRST! I think this was the most helpful advice on people's reviews; you can burn yourself very badly, make a huge mess or brake the machine if you don't. I can see why a lot of people have broken their machine or had mishaps because it seems like they do take a little finesse. If you live alone, I think this is the perfect machine (no one else around to break it). The only thing I would recommend if you buy this product on amazon is to get the 49mm tamper (fits this machine's filter) and a frothing pitcher because it does not come with either of these. I ended up having to order mine seperate off amazon because most stores don't carry these types of products in stock and if they do they are way too expensive. You can get by without these of course but it was only like $18 for a 12 oz. milk frothing pitcher and the tamper. Cheap appliances can suprise you sometimes. I still have my $8 coffee maker my Mom bought me to move into the dorms with 6 years ago.
Hints to using this machine:
~Make sure the steam cap is REALLY tight otherwise steam will appear out of the top during use and you can get burned or make a mess.
~Do not overfill with water! You have to release the pressure (in the instructions)of the machine before opening the steam cap and it will take forever if you are done making your latte or cappucino and there is still a lot of water left in the reservoir because you have to use the frothing arm to do so.
~Everything metal on this machine gets blazing hot even after you turn it off. Don't touch anything until it has cooled down completely, I had shut mine down taken off the steam cap and was wiping the unit down, rested my arm on top and burned the bejesus out of myself by just barely making contact with the metal on top of the water reservoir.
~You must have enough water in order to use the steamer. The instructions are very well written and have a troubleshooting section that is very helpful.
Good luck with this machine, have had great experience so far, worth the money.
title: Great machine for the price! Going to save money and time in the long run!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: This machine doesn't deliver the gourmet taste or 'frothy' foam that my other similar machine did. It doesn't seem to have as much power or punch and it leaks if you fill it more than 1 1/2 cups full.
title: This machine doesn't deliver the gourmet taste or 'frothy' foam ...
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Caf√© Steam

review_content:
I am the latte drinker in my family and have owned an espresso maker for quite a while. After years of owning several steam ("el cheapo") types of machines, I finally bit the bullet and asked for a pump style two years ago for Christmas. I received a Delonghi and really loved it. (After all it was a HUGE improvement over what I had owned in the past.) It finally bit the dust in September of this year. (Not quite two years old... but I do use it everyday, sometimes multiple times...) I did my research and decided to buy this one locally, really because I needed it NOW! (I mentioned I use it everyday....) My first attempt started rather well, I like the design, the water basin is great, you can remove it, but you don't have to. The unit heats up very quickly and pulls a great cup of espresso and then the frothing feature is amazing... I have never owned a more powerful unit. My Delonghi could froth well, but nothing like this bad boy. I found that my standard sized frothing pitcher was not near large enough. I can only froth 1/3 to 1/2 a cup of 1% at a time or I get serious overload. Since I need a whole cup frothed for my drink, I am having to froth two or three times for one drink. I understand that this is not the fault of the machine, I am thrilled that it has the power to create froth as well as the coffee houses do. However, I am concerned about being able to find a larger pitcher that is not too deep as the frothing wand is not very long and extends pretty low on the side of the machine. This feature alone is not enough to cause my star rating to drop to four. As I mentioned in my title, this is round two for me. About three weeks after I purchased my first unit, I had a day when the machine seemed to "flip out". I was pulling the shot of espresso, it started sputtering and making a weird noise. I turned the knob to the off position and pushed the froth button and all seemed to go fine, then I thought I would try to pull another shot just to be sure it was working. I started over with new beans and all went fine. So then I went to froth the remaining milk and the frothing feature would not work! I would push the froth button, it would flash a few times and then switch itself to the shot light and you could pull another shot, but not froth. Later in the day, I tried it again and it seemed to work fine, but after that it began to leak like a sieve on my counter. So, I took it back. I exchanged it for the same unit and I notice it leaks a bit too, but not like the other one. I like the taste and quality of the espresso I brew so much I will not be taking it back for the puddle it creates, but I sure wish it didn't do that!

**Edit** After reading some of the reviews, I decided to try to remove the black rubber tip from the frothing tube. This did NOT work for me. It still steamed, but it did not froth at all. One of the biggest perks of this machine for me is the high frothing output obtained when steaming. So, I promptly returned the rubber tip to it's rightful place. Just remember to take it off daily to clean under it, it will get nasty if you don't.
title: This is round number two for me!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: This was my 3rd Mr. Coffee espresso machine. I got my first one in the 90‚Äôs, and it lasted for years and years of daily use. The 2nd started leaking steam out of the coffee basket after a few years, but this latest model didn‚Äôt even make it 6 months. The brew/steam/off knob has a cheap plastic shaft that just snapped when I tried to turn the machine on. When I contacted Mr. Coffee they said the knob wasn‚Äôt covered under warranty and there was nothing they could do. Cheap product!!! Don‚Äôt waste your money!
title: Broken within 6 months
bought_model: Color: BlackStyle Name: Steam + Starter Set

review_content: I bought this machine in July of 2016; it has lasted about 8 months. From another company, my previous machine -- for around the same price as this one -- lasted many years. Unfortunately, that one is no longer made. Mr. Coffee espresso has been decent tasting; the frother was good. But now, the coffee's coming out cold and the frother's not working. Also the glass part of the carafe loosened from its handle.  I don't want to spend hundreds on an espresso machine, but needing to replace this one already is a waste of cash. Unfortunately, its low price reflects its shoddy workmanship.
title: Disappointing
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I'll admit, I'm a bit disappointed in this product. I LOVE Mr. Coffee products, but this one isn't up to par, in my opinion. Each time I use it, I have to fiddle with it for quite awhile before the three lights stop blinking. With those lights blinking, I can't make my latte or cappuccino. You have to wait for them to stop blinking which takes some fiddling and patience. I have no idea why they blink for so long or what I'm doing wrong as I have follow the instructions to a T.

The milk frothier is a bit disappointing as well. Don't expect the foam you see in the picture. I don't mind that too much as I don't like a ton of foam, but a little more would be nice. I've also noticed that to fill my cup, I have to brew the large and small size which is a bit of a pain. I'm still trying to figure out how much espresso to use to make the latte or cappuccino really good. I haven't succeeded there, yet (and it's been 2 months).

Personally, I think you're better off with the Mr. Coffee Latte Maker. I LOVE that product; however, you can't use fine ground espresso in it. You have to get a coarser ground (like the ones you see at the supermarket).
title: Decent, but not great
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
I had really wanted an espresso machine for Christmas and was thrilled to get this machine. I found the directions to be difficult to understand for a first time espresso machine owner. I had a really hard time getting the filter holder/filter into the proper slot. Once I figured it out, it did brew a nice cup of espresso. I often use the Starbucks Dark Espresso roast and find that I need to grind it further to get the espresso strong enough. It does brew fairly quickly, but it doesn't stay hot for long so use it right away.

I love to make lattes and mochas and this was one of the reasons I wanted this machine. I was able to also receive some mocha powder as well as some flavored syrups to fill my addiction! My problem is the steam frother. I also received a small metal pitcher, but it only holds about 8 oz. Once you begin to froth, it rises up and spills out of the pitcher. Next step was a larger pitcher. Now the frothing arm is not long enough. It also seemed to just take forever to get it to the right consistency. By the time I brewed the espresso and then frothed the milk, the espresso was cold. I also didn't like that you needed to refill the reservoir after brewing. You have to be mighty careful with the blast of steam that escapes.

For me, it just isn't worth the hassle to use the frother. I now just brew some espresso and use my old handheld frother. Much better result and much easier for me.
title: Fine for espresso yet frother is useless
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: Very disappointed in this espresso maker.  The espresso is not as strong as the older model machines BY FAR.  I do not even drink the espresso by itself any more.  I just use it to put into the other coffee to strengthen the regular coffee.  I probably should just throw this thing away, it is worthless for espresso.  It is pretty though.
title: Very disappointed in this espresso maker
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Caf√© Steam

review_content:
I bought a used version of this machine about 3 months ago. I read a lot of mixed reviews about it but I have had a good experience using it! It makes pretty darn good coffee, I mean its not as good as a 500 dollar machine but for a machine for home use and under 100 dollars you can't beat it! I think every machine has its pro's and con's but I love it. I am glad I went with this machine instead of another one! And for all those folks that said it leaks underneath, its not leaking....there is a removable tray that you have to periodically have to take out and dump. It releases the excess water from the process in there. I usually take it out after making about 4 cups. If you don't take it out, it will overflow. But it doesn't leak in any way!

Pros :
*Makes great coffee!
*Heats up SUPER SUPER quick!!
*Froths Very very easy
*Super User Friendly
*All parts are washable in the dishwasher!
*Very easy to keep clean!

Cons:
*Doesn't come with cups or frothing cup
*Frother want isn't very long
*Piece that you pack in the coffee grounds with is a bit flimsy
*Would be nice if the coffee came out a teeny bit hotter
*Tip on the frothing want comes loose when you pull off the rubber for cleaning, but if you tighten it periodically its not a big deal

All in all a great machine and I would recommend it to anyone looking in this price range. You really can't go wrong with it!!
title: Great Machine At A Great Price!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
Works well and quickly. The 'on' light is clearly visible, the previous machine had a faint one on the side resulting in frequent oversight to turn it off. Well this is NOT a pump machine, but fortunately my taste buds are sufficiently tolerant.

I took one star off because the handle on the grind bowl broke when I banged it on the mulch can. (That reminds me ... I replaced the sieve basket with the one from my old one, that stays in the grind bowl, since the one on this machine is loose.
title: Great 'boiling pressure' Espresso maker
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: So.. I followed the directions for making a latte. And i have been a barista before. I tried brewing the espresso as it said, and then switched to steam my milk. The milk started getting sucked into the machine through the frothing wand! I had the parts on properly and on the correct setting and then i tried to steam my milk and it got sucked into the water compartment and it finished brewing the coffee and milk! So stupid. Very unsatisfied. It also is EXTREMELY loud.
title: Loud and the steamer didn't work.
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Being half south american and half half itlian, real coffee is big thing for me. I hate regular coffee. I like the smell and taste of spresso coffee and that is why i decided to byt this little miracle.
It's been almost 2 months and i don't regret buying it. This little spresso machine makes delicious spresso coffee. I love having my lattes in the morning and i looooove the smell of fresh spresso just made innmy kitchen.
I recommend this item to whoever don't wanna spend a lot of money and is looking for a very good spresso machine for under $200.
title: Good for the price
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
This is a budget latte/cappuccino machine. It gets the job done-but unlikely to be satisfactory. In particular, the milk frothing function give you lukewarm, inconsistently big foam. Any starbucks latte/cappacino, and even my existing $30 stand-alone milk frother beat it handily.

The pro is that everything is completed with 1 click.
title: A budget latte/cappuccino machine
bought_model: Color: RedStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
I'm pleased with this bargain buy.

The espresso it gives me is pretty good and not much trouble to make. It's not really more work than using and cleaning my regular Mr Coffee coffee machine.

I highly recommend you buy the Blue 49mm Espresso Tamper Stainless Steel Coffee that is an almost perfect fit. It made a huge difference to use it to to get a firm, solid pack of the grounds. With this tamper, the espresso was thicker and richer (not as watery) as it was using the free little plastic spoon as the tamper.

This espresso maker does still not produce that thick espresso "syrup" you get from an industrial strength machine or Starbucks but it is a great starter.

Have modest ambitions and you'll be pleasantly surprised with this product.
title: Great bargain & not a bad product!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: Mr. Coffee makes reliable products that last.  This is a well-designed little espresso machine that's a great buy for the money.  I got my first Mr. Coffee espresso machine about 15 years ago.  It was still going strong when I moved on to a higher end machine by a different company -- that machine lasted less than a year.  Then I replaced that one with yet another brand of high-end espresso machine that lasted only a month.  So now I've gone back to Mr. Coffee.  Meanwhile, Mr. Coffee has clearly been improving its design.  This one delivers great pump pressure, and in all of its details is just right.  An unpretentious little friend for the espresso lover.
title: Reliable, unpretentious, well-designed espresso maker with good pump pressure.
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
UPDATE: I still LOVE this machine. I've had it for a while now and still running great. You simply can't beat the price for an entry level espresso machine. I find the espresso it makes is good and have started to grind my own coffee and experiment a bit. Nice espresso with nice crema.

As far as the frother....this works great. I do use the rubber wand cover when I want to make a thicker foam....but if I'm trying to make micro-foam, I remove it. Either ways, works very well. I've reduced my time at Starbucks so much I could have bought 5 of this machines this year :). Simply, the most bang-for-my-buck puchase I've made in a long time.

The only negative, but no big deal, is I do get some water under the machine on the counter after using. I think this happens when I remove the water tank to fill. No biggie, though...as part of my after-use cleanup, I make sure to slide the machine over and wipe up any water. I've though about moving up to a more expensive espresso machine but my wife thinks I'm crazy as she loves the morning lattes and caps I make from this one.

********************************************************************************

I've had this machine now for a few weeks and so far I've been extremely impressed. It makes a great espresso, foamer wand works well...though could be a tad longer, and all-in-all an amazing bargain. And yes, if this is your first time buying an espresso machine, you do need to take the time to clean after each use...the wand, the filter, the base (where the water collects), etc. It may seem like a pain, but think of the time you're saving not standing in line at SB and the gas money :)

Still trying to figure out how to make the perfect foam, but getting there. Lot's of recommendation online on techniques :)
title: Great Machine at an Amazing Price
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
This coffee maker is great. If you use good coffee, it makes a cappuccino that rivals Starbucks... At least a few times a week, I'd get a cappuccino on the way to work... With this, I don't buy them in Starbucks/Dunkin' Donuts anymore. It's fast as well. When you turn it on, you have to wait for only a minute for the water to warm up. ... it's easy to use, where you only press one button to get your drink.

Problem: In my unit, the water tank that slides in the back doesn't fit perfectly. There is a rubber seal that prevents the water from leaking out between the tank and the main unit. Well it doesn't fit perfectly, and so it leaks... from the first time I added water. This machine isn't of the greatest marksmanship, it's all plastic and for the price, i didn't expect more. However, you'd think something like a seal between the tank and the unit, would be better designed. I'm thinking of sealing the tank to the main unit and pouring water into the tank with a pitcher...
title: Great coffee, no more Dunkin' Donuts in the AM
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: This little guy has saved me SO much money! (Sorry Starbucks!) It makes delicious cappuccinos and lattes or just plain espresso. I prefer the latte setting and I use a pump of hazelnut syrup to sweeten it. Delicious! A few things: 1.) It's a little quirky - fill up the milk all the way every time. It's weird about getting that last inch of milk. I just keep the entire milk reservoir in the fridge. 2.) It's loud, if you get up when everyone else is still sleeping, it might wake them up. 3.) The scoop/tamper they give you is a joke, it's just flimsy plastic. Invest in a nice heavy tamper. Other than that I haven't had any major problems. Just use a good quality coffee, & make sure it's ground for espresso. Then kiss those $5 lattes goodbye.
title: Bye Starbucks!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: I am on my third machine but I love the convenience of making Starbucks quality drinks at home and with the Square trade warranty - I am never really out anymore money than I was when I first bought the item.  My first machine had something go wrong with the sucker that froths the milk.  The warranty covered it - I just got a new machine.  The second one had some sort of an electrical issue (nothing major) but it started making a funny electrical sound when some of the buttons were pushed.  Mr Coffee just sent me a new one and had me send back the defective one.  Makes great coffees.
title: I am spoiled
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
So much fun to play house Barista. Has useful presettings and more importantly it has manual modes for milk and espresso so you can make your own shots. I use this daily as I need to make ristretto shots to make my own Flat Whites.

So far each component I wanted to clean does have a method to remove and clean it, which is also awesome.

No complaints so far.
title: So much fun to play house Barista
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: This makes an excellent latte. Minus one star because start up is slow and brewing is LOUD. My dad was also dissapointed that it can't make a cup of regular coffee. With an actual espresso press, it makes me feel like a barista every time I make my morning latte. I've experimented putting tea into the espresso bean cup part and it can make a lovely tea latte as well.
title: This makes an excellent latte. Minus one star because start up is ...
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: O.M.G.! I'm wired....just received this amazing invention this morning (in two days!) and already drank 300 cappies and lattes...no, seriously, I really could with this machine, it is just that good and easy.  Instructions are easy to follow - just make sure you prime the maker - and in less than five minutes you have a cuppa that rivals any shop. I used skim milk and it was fine, even tho some people say it froths too thin. Can't wait to make my next cup, which will probably be after I finish this review. So...bye bye, off to make another delicious latte.
title: PERFECT FOR THIS SNOWY DAY
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
Easy to use and seems to be somewhat durable as long as you keep it clean! The frother wand is at an odd angle so you'll have to use a smaller container for milk than you would like, but it's perfect for one or two servings of milk, depending on drink size.

Update: One year later and the machine is still working perfectly with no issues at all. Still 4 stars because I wish I could use a larger milk container with the frother wand.
title: Easy to use and seems to be somewhat durable as ...
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: Temperamental!!! I have had mine for six months now. First the espresso cup is not stainless and will become nasty. Second it does not throw consistent cups. Running about three cups through it before you make express helps but it will still run the cup over sometimes others only half fill it. All and all I have buyers regret, should have bought a manual machine and just learned how to make it.
title: Temperamental!!! I have had mine for six ...
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Terrible terrible terrible. Tough to know when to listen to the 1 star reviews and I would have saved myself the headache had I listened on this product. Spews steam and hot water all over the place, leaves the carafe 2/3 of the way full from whichever point you fill it (because at least 1/3 of the water winds up on the counter). I tried to stick with this thing and give it a chance figuring maybe I had to break it in or something. Finally I've had enough after the thing exploded and sent a ridiculous mess of coffee grounds from the machine to 5' down my counter top, grounds in between all of my appliances, I may as well have tried to brew a lit firecracker with my coffee grounds.
title: Complete mess
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
There is so much i love about this espresso system! Unfortunately though, I have only had it for a couple of months and the top plastic black portion has not remained in place and is coming unattached from the top metal part (to the top right above where it reads "Mr. Coffee". It appears that this system does not hold well through steam and the steam is pushing it apart.
I would like a replacement but that is not an option since 30days have already past.
title: Great...until it melts apart.
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I bought this to replace my Krups espresso machine. I drink 2-4 shots of espresso daily, so I would say that I am a heavy "user/abuser" of espresso machines.

Not only does this make a great cup of espresso, (with a little froth on top, even), but it has lasted through 2-3 uses per day since I bought it almost a year ago.

The only downside to this excellent little machine is that it has started leaking a bit near the end of the brew cycle. I have been keeping a microfiber towel nearby to catch the leak. That is probably not a great long term solution, but for now, I am going to run this machine until it starts smoking...which looks to be longer from now than I would have expected!

** Update to comment: 1/14 Okay, this machine is leaking terrible now. The only way to use it is to pile microfiber towels around the base and watch while they sop up 60% of the water that I poured into the water chamber. It's going to have to go to the curb. I guess, for the price, I got my money's worth. Not sure if I will buy another one of this brand.
title: Love it....even though it leaks
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: Amazing product! Very simple to use and a fun treat for myself and guests!
title: Highly recommend!
bought_model: Color: RedStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: This thing is pretty bad ass, I suppose. But instant coffee is still so much stronger.
title: Five Stars
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: Bought a used machine here-buttons don't work-very frustrating!!!!
title: Press the Button
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
Overall I'm very pleased with this machine especially given the price. I would like the Espresso shots to be stronger, but I also need to experiment with different coffee beans too. It could be that the Lavazzo Super Crema Espresso beans I purchased just aren't rich enough for my liking. With the Lavazzo beans I end up making 4-shot Latte's and Cappuccino's to get a good coffee flavor.

In terms of cleaning it's a breeze. Just hold one button for a few seconds and it automatically cleans out the frothing tube.

The best part of this machine is the automation, followed by the high quality drink it produces, followed by the excellent price and overall value this machine provides.
title: Automation, High Quality Drink, and Excellent Pricing & Value equals a No-brainer
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: I cant drink coffee from ather coffee maker , thanks mr.coffee
title: It great machine
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: the best
title: Five Stars

review_content: THE TOP  OF THE WATER TANK IS NOT HAVING GRIP AND IS NOT ALIGNING PROPERLY WITH THE GROOVES.
title: THE TOP OF THE WATER TANK IS NOT HAVING GRIP ...

review_content: Works great with espresso ground coffee from Starbucks

review_content: Great product

bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Great product! One year after purchased works fine. It is not professional, but I get descend cappuccinos and lattes.  We enjoy having coffee moments together in family.  And obviously using the best coffee: Costa Rican coffee!
title: Great product! One year after purchased works fine
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Better than any Italian, French, or German espresso machine.
title: Best one!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: Works well for while and then breaks. I am on my second one. Pay a Little more and get the next model in line.
title: Cheap
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: Our first Mr Coffee Espresso machine was perfect. It didn't take very much counter space and made good coffee. Unfortunately the handles for the coffee holder came off rather quickly but we gorilla glued it back on. Then the handle for the carcade fell off after about a year. We really liked the size and convenience so we bought another one. They must gave gotten a new manufacturer because there is an awful smell that comes from water reservoir and a bad taste in the coffee. I wrote to the company and they graciously sent me a new one. But.. The new one has the same problem!! I'm looking for a new espresso maker that doesn't take much counter space and doesn't smell and taste like chemicals!!! Even after many uses!!
title: Smelly!!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: I like this as a new espresso owner. However I am sure I will upgrade at some point. Works great.
title: I like this as a new espresso owner
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: This latte maker is great!!  It makes the perfect latte, just the way I like it, and allows me to add extra foam, which I like!  It's easy to use and easy to clean.  I couldn't be happier!
title: GREAT latte maker!!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: What a great espresso maker this is. It's so simple to use & I was a once a day Starbucks person. Now I don't have to because to me this machine makes better lattes than Starbucks. WELL WORTH THE MONEY & HAS ALREADY PAID FOR ITSELF.
title: GREATEST ESPRESSO MACHINE EVER!!!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Awesome machine!!!!! Been using it for 3yrs and it still works like a champ. Espresso with crema from home! Yes please.  I ordered a 2nd machine just because they work so well.  I don't use the steamer but it seems pretty powerful.
title: Best Home Espresso Ever!  Haven't been to Starbuck's in months :D
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: Good machine but the coffee filter didnt let water through, so i had to use one from my previous machine.
title: Good machine but the coffee filter didnt let water through
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: Impossible to find Espresso Filter Holder, ours broke, not sold on Amazon, and the one sold on official website does not work. : FAIL
title: Impossible to find Espresso Filter Holder, ours broke, ...
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: I love it
title: Five Stars
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Ordered this along with an encore conical burr grinder, nice weighted tamper, and a food thermometer for tracking the milk temperature. We had our first two double shot cappuccinos made within 30 minutes of the box arriving at our door. This machine can do everything you need to make a starbucks or better quality drink, provided you have good beans. Very easy to set up and understand. Really thought we would end up spending way more money to make our own espresso at home.
title: Quality espresso for very little money!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: Almost sent this back because I didn't realize the cord is WRAPPED around an anchor on the bottom of the unit! I thought it was a very short cord! Once I could plug it in, it functions just fine. Not bad for the money.
title: it functions just fine. Not bad for the money
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: After more then 2 years, i still LOVE my machine... wish i could buy one to keep at my office.... i enjoy my homemade drinks way more then Starbucks... and i was a daily starbucks drinker....
title: I love after all these years
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: After buying a Delonghi for our personal use, I tried this machine at a summer home and am sending the darn thing back and ordering another Delonghi. I have had bad luck with Mr. Coffee products but I thought I would save a few bucks. Learned my lesson! Stick with what works.
title: Not user friendly
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: Received a defective item. The water kept leaking from the water reservoir as the seal was defective. It made a mess and i had to clean it. Btw, I did remove the red tape from the bottom, tried priming the machine, but this happened every single time. I am returning this item and will look for something else.
title: Water leaks every single time
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: This is absolutely the best things I've bought in years!  I use it at least once a day.  Usually two or three times a day!  Can't say enough positives about it. The only negative I would have is that it is loud. This doesn't bother me as I live by myself but it could be annoying if you have a small place with others trying to sleep in. Super easy to clean.  Super easy to use!
title: Great investment!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Easy, simple to use after my first try. Well worth the cheap price. Will update if things change, but for now....üëç
title: Works great
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
I bought the Mr. Coffee Caf√© Barista for my daughter for Christmas. She opened it, read the directions, and never got past priming the unit. It does not work. The information says to contact the manufacturer rather than returning it to place of purchase. She called and was on hold for over 45 minutes, then gave up. She then got on the computer for a "live chat" with Mr. Coffee, and still had no response. She then e-mailed them and was supposed to hear back within 3 business day. Nothing. I thought I was doing the right thing by buying her a name brand product, but never again. What horrible customer service and what a huge waste of my money.
I will also never buy a product like this from Amazon again. If I had gotten it at Walmart, I could have returned it to the store.

title: AWESOME PRODUCT!!!!
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: This espresso machine is amazing for the price. It's compact, pretty sturdy for its size and it looks good in the kitchen. I've experimented with this machine in the last few weeks and I've liked it more and more with each passing day. Here's a tip for those of you who like a frothy cup of cappuccino. Make sure your milk is at room temperature and is not straight from the fridge cold. This machine does not come with a frothing wand so you can't warm the milk up that way and get it to froth. The little milk chute froths the milk and pumps it directly into your cup of coffee. If your milk is cold, the milk chute does not have enough power or heat to froth the milk. What I do is take my milk out from the fridge and heat a little up in a small pan over the stove to get it a little warm and then I pour it into the coffee machine's milk dispenser. This helps it froth up better and the machine sends a perfect stream of hot frothy milk into the waiting cup. Sure it takes a little more time but why rush when you're making yourself a great cup of coffee to start the day :)
title: A tip for those who like a frothy cup of cappuccino or latte
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
This is a great little machine for an amateur. It's got a small footprint so it doesn't take up a ton of space in my galley kitchen, and it's shorter than my drip coffee maker, so it fits easily under the cupboard, even with the accessories stored on top of it.
There is a bit of a learning curve in terms of steaming milk, but if you follow the included instructions, it's pretty simple. I was able to make a good cappuccino on the second try (I didn't steam the milk long enough on the first).

One note: The instructions say to start steaming the milk once brewing has begun, but it works better if you wait until brewing is almost finished.

Once you get the hang of it, it doesn't take any more time than brewing drip coffee. As my family knows, I'm a horrible cranky swamp monster until I've had my first cup of coffee, so time is of the essence in the morning! This machine is simple enough to work before I'm fully awake, and the result is worth it.

Definitely worth the small investment, especially if you're a first-timer and aren't sure you want to make the $500+ investment in a more professional machine.
title: My First Espresso Maker
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
First off, I am glad I got this when I did in red as the price went way up now. So watch those price fluctuations.

I have had it for about 2 weeks now and used all the options on it. I can't speak to how it will hold up long term as its much to early for that.
I did get another tamper as some have suggested and it works better for me. But I think the one that comes with it can also work. I just needed something to grab onto better.

I was looking around and comparing machines. I ended up getting this Mr. Coffee for a couple of reasons. I cannot afford an expensive espresso machine and in the entry level market, I think they are all about the same with the 15 bar pumps. So I was looking at those with steamwands and this one. I wanted a machine I can make cappuccinos with and maybe lattes and cortados.
The reason I settled on this one instead of one with a wand is the amount of milk used. I am the only one that makes milk based drinks and with a wand, one has to put a certain amount in a separate container and that milk is then used up. With this machine, it only dispenses what you need. So if I make a small cappuccino or a cortado, it uses not very much milk. And the rest of the milk stays fresh and untouched and goes back in the fridge. Its less wasteful for my uses I believe. For a cortado for example, I make so little milk that it would not work with a wand. You have to put in to a certain level on those.

Its also nice not having to fiddle with a wand and just pressing a button and it does it all for you.

I have a good grinder already as I also use other methods of making coffee still. Aeropress, pourover, etc. I got this for making milk drinks mostly. So I use fresh whole beans for this just like I do for my other methods. My husband likes the bustelo I got so I could get the espresso grind just right on my grinder.

When I first got it I did the priming which too 3 tries. Then I did the vinegar cleanse as I saw one reviewer describe. Can't hurt to get all the factory oils and grime out of the pipes in any case. After that I played with the weight and grind. I always weigh my beans and I can fit 7 grams in the small holder and 14 grams in the large. That works out best for me. I had a few were I either tamped too hard or had a too fine grind and nothing came out. Just stop the machine and go courser or don't tamp so hard.

You can either let the machine do it all with one button press, or you can make a espresso first, do the manual milk in a separate container and then pour it over the espresso. I do that when I make cortados. That way you can swirl the milk and have less bubbles in it. So you can easily make froth to put on top of hot chocolate. I made some to put in my Pero drink, which is a grain based non coffee drink.
Besides the presets there are manual options for the espresso, so if you want you can hold the button down and it puts up to 5 ounce of extra on the shot. I suppose to can hit it twice and make a larger cup. But I prefer to make americanos. Make the espresso and then pour hot water over it from the kettle. It does work though holding the espresso button if that is what you prefer to get the hot water that way. The other manual button is the froth, which you also activate by holding the button for 3 seconds. Just be careful to watch that as it just keeps coming out for like 30 seconds. I walked away the first time and my big mug overflowed like crazy. Just hit the button again to make it stop.

So its pretty flexible outside of the presets.

It cleans quite easy. I always run a cleaning cycle through the milk wand. It takes 30 seconds and at the same time I clean the portafilter. That is pretty much it. Wipe the wand and put the milk container back in the fridge.
And from time to time I run a empty portafilter to clean out the grinds from underneath and wipe around a bit.

It does what I wanted it to do. I still have my pour over coffees or my aeropress, but I like to have a couple of milk based drinks during the day. When I get really fancy I put some syrups in it. I like the sugar free Monin ones for that.

I also got me a knockbox for all the grinds. I don't really want to smack it on my garbage can and I don't want to put them in the sink. Works great.
title: Does what I want it to do
bought_model: Color: RedStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
let me start off by saying, we drink LOTS of latte/cappuccino in our house, we go through them like TPs. our first starter espresso machine Krups XP1000 (less than 50 bucks) lasted us little over 2 years, our previous De'Longhi EC155 (80 bucks) lasted us 2 years, and looks like this Mr Coffee ECMP1000 (mid one hundred bucks) died just after 1.5 years. sigh...... why don't things last these days. i keep thinking maybe the more expensive i go up the ladder, maybe they'll stop dying and last a bit longer.

Aside from using the deep cleaning feature everytime after we finished using it, we also regularly clean this thing by taking the frothing tubing portion of the module apart, because the frothing portion of the machine does clog up after about 20 cups, without cleaning the internal tubings, the ratio/portion of the milk would be off. The procedure isn't hard, you just have to remember how you take it apart so you can put it back together. unfortunately, after 1.5 years, seems like the internal pump that's dedicated to the frothing steam isn't working anymore. it stopped sucking up milk and sounds like the pump isn't priming anymore. i suspect it's dual pump setup with one for espresso, one for froth. the espresso portion of the pump still works, although sounds pretty rough too the last time we used it.

we go through 4~5 cups a day, X 365 days and X 1.5 year = 2,737 cups MTBF (or mean "cup" before failure).

this may be ok for the casual drinkers, but those who go through lattes heavily like we do, i recommend steer away and look elsewhere.

when it worked, the ease and convenience is nice. you can pretty much set it to amount of froth you want, either latte or cappuccino, and just walk away, and come back in about a min and everything is done. only thing is you can't mix the sugar in with the froth before hand like a manual frothing machine could. you would just have to put the sugar in after everything is done and stir.

for a steam based espresso machine, which tend to be cheap for beginners, i could be forgiving in their longevity, but for pump based machines, 1.5 years is just ridiculous.

on to the next. ..
title: requires regular cleaning, died after 1.5 years
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: This is a 2 star review for one reason: short lifespan. The machine works well as advertised, and the expresso is good quality--I have used it twice a day (or more) for two years, and I can validate the results of the more positive reviews here. However, after the first year, it began to leak water from underneath with every use. At first, it was only a small amount, but gradually the leak has become worse; now, it leaks twice as much water as the amount of expresso it produces in a single use, and I have to replace it. My previous expresso maker, a Krupps, lasted almost 15 years before failing. In contrast, the Mr. Coffee gave me one year of trouble free service before it began to fail; I will not buy one again.
title: Good expresso, short lifespan
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
I did my research on Cafe Barista's and I decided to give Mr. Coffee a try. These little coffee makers can cost in the hundreds and even thousands of dollars, but because of all the decent reviews on amazon concerning this model I purchased it.
At first I was going to return this back to Amazon because I was concerned that much of the maker is made of plastic. I called Mr. Coffee and spoke to one of their customer care reps and she guaranteed that all Mr. Coffee products are BPA free.
I decided to keep this and my family and I are amazed how this lil machine can make a latte just as good or better than the big corporate coffee houses out there. I'm totally serious and the Mr. Coffee Barista makes an incredible, most delicious latte, indeed.

Now I will tell you how I make my latte.
8 ounces of Silk Almond/Coconut milk
1 full scoop of Kona Hawaiian ground coffee from Kroger
1 teaspoon of organic coconut sugar

I pack 1 full scoop of Kona coffee into the filter for Single Shot of Espresso. Make sure you place the Porta-Filter on your counter and put some muscle into packing down your coffee grounds using the Measuring Scoop/Tamper which comes with this
Coffeemaker. By packing my coffee down I believe much of the delicious coffee flavor is extracted from the grounds.
There is a line on the Froth Control Knob and I line it up with coffee icon on the machine. I believe the machine gives me the most milk froth where I set the Froth Control Knob.
Make sure you aim your Froth Tube into the center of your coffee cup.
I push the Latte button on the Control Panel twice for a large Latte and out comes my foamy, most delicious, most heavenly milk froth and than
my Kona coffee.

It's that easy folks and you will not be disappointed with the purchase of Mr. Coffee Barista. Why spend hundreds of dollars on the fancier machines when you can make delicious coffee drinks with this machine. Just buy it, you will not be disappointed.
title: I was hesitant about purchasing this particular machine, but my family and I are so glad we purchased it!
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
Love this little machine! I've never brewed expresso before and was able to do so easily with the provided instruction booklet. The step by step instructions are very clear and easy to follow. I have only used this machine for 2 days, so I can't comment on the life span or durability of the machine at this time. Butttt as of this very moment, I couldn't be more pleased with this purchase!!

A little tip for anyone other novice barista considering purchasing this expresso machine... Make sure you buy expresso beans already ground up or buy a grinder so you can grind the beans yourself. Also, this set does have a froth/steam option but does not come with a frothing pitcher to the steam milk in. So you might want to toss an expresso bean grinder and frothing pitcher in your shopping cart too.
title: Expresso anyone?
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
Wife makes a cup a day for the last six months. No issues so far. She runs the cleaning cycle every time she uses the frother. We have not run any cleaning solutions through the water, and we have not noticed any decrease in performance.

The frother bugs me a bit when I make hot chocolate, but if I stir the milk in my cup as it's being poured, it seems to cut down on the frothiness of it.

*UPDATE*

Running strong for over a year now! I should probably clean it sometime... Haven't noticed any decrease in performance yet due to not cleaning.

*ANOTHER UPDATE*

We ordered this on December 5, 2015. Today is September 27, 2017. Why the update? The frother stopped working on latte mode!

I first cracked open the milk dispenser top to see if there was a clog. Turns out, it's super simple in there, and not much to clean. I paged through the manual, and there's a section in there about cleaning. Hey, wouldn't you know, Mr. Coffee says to run vinegar through the thing once every forty-eighty cups to delime it! My wife has been pretty regular in her coffee habit, minus missing a few days, plus making a few cups for guests, so I would estimate we're about 660 cups in so far! Just a little bit over the eighty cups they recommend a cleaning at for those of us with hard water.

Anyway, I (sorta) followed the deliming instructions, ran a half gallon of vinegar through it using both the espresso and cleaning cycles, and the latte setting on the frother works again.

And for those of you who are wary... this thing works great! My wife isn't a coffee snob, but this machine is helping her to become one. She's (mostly) sworn off that overpriced star place's coffee, as she's come to find it's very bitter, unless there's a pound of sugar in it, then it's too sweet. While the Mr. Coffee Cafe Barista doesn't have all sorts of fancy features as you may see in more expensive models, this bad boy reliably delivers what it promises, and can save you tons of money! Just think... We've spent maybe $100 on espresso pre-ground coffee, $300 on cocoa (it's good cocoa) & syrups. Compare that with the, at very least, $4/cup, and we're looking at $540 for 660 cups with the Mr. Coffee, compared to $2,640+ for coffee from that star place. Pretty good deal!
title: "Broke" after ~660 days... but then I delimed it.
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Purchased for an anniversary gift for my wife.  She likes the machine a lot, largely because it is very easy to use and the espresso drinks taste fine.  The removable milk container is great as it can just go in and out of the refrigerator as needed.  After a month of use, the little plastic clip broke on the filter assembly.  It isn't a critical piece, so the machine functions fine.  However, contacting Mr. Coffee to see if it would be covered under warranty was an exercise in futility.  Submit email.  Get an automated reply with a reference number.  Never hear back.  Repeat.  I tried chatting, but it must have been too close to closing time, because they kept cancelling out my chat sessions until live chat was closed for the day.  Fortunately, I have a Square Trade warranty on the machine so if anything else breaks I will be able to go through them.  It's a good starter machine and worth it at the $99-$150 price point, but not for any higher price than that.  (They have a new version selling at $329... yikes.) I won't buy a Mr. Coffee again if their support can't respond to a simple question, so when this one dies we will no doubt upgrade to a better brand.
title: We like how easy it is to use the machine, but Mr. Coffee support is a disappointment.
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
This machine gets 4 stars, given that it's also only $40. In other words, I didn't have high expectations, so it's a pleasant surprise that it works at all! The short review is that it makes a perfectly acceptable shot for a latte; but the quality isn't high enough to sip it as an espresso. And it does a fine job of steaming milk.

The good:
‚Ä¢ the machine itself is small, lightweight and easy to clean. Plus it was quite inexpensive, as espresso machines go!
‚Ä¢ It's a pretty simple process to make a latte. I've never owned any other machine like this, so maybe others are just as simple.
‚Ä¢ the steamer makes nice hot milk with decent foam (I actually use almond milk, so I can't say what it would do with regular milk)
‚Ä¢ after 10 days of practicing, I've figured out how to get a shot that produces a darn tasty morning latte.

The bad:
‚Ä¢ it takes a LONG time to pull a shot (3 minutes?); and even when I'm only making a single 2-ounce shot, the machine slows down twice, tempting me to believe it's finished even though I have less than 2 oz of espresso in the carafe. But no, if I just wait patiently it does eventually produce a full 2 oz of espresso.
‚Ä¢ the steamer arm is poorly designed. It only sticks out about an inch from the machine, so you can't move it around much in your cup of milk. Another reviewer had recommended tossing the black casing right from the outset, so I did that too. Never even tried using it.
‚Ä¢ the shot produced by this machine doesn't have any crema at all
‚Ä¢ the cleaning instructions were insufficient: the first 3 shots I pulled, after having cleaned the machine, left a bit of white powder on top of the coffee grounds.

A few usage tips:

‚Ä¢ The directions say to start by brewing your shot but then switch to steam in the middle, and then go back to finish pulling your shot after your milk is hot. That seems crazy to me so instead this is what I do: When I first turn the machine on, I start with it in the steam position. I do this after having poured my milk into a mug. While the machine is heating up, I measure out my coffee and attach the little basket to the machine. As soon as steam starts coming out, I began heating and frothing my milk. This takes about 60 seconds, for 6-8 ounces of cold milk. Once my milk is nice and hot I switch the knob to brew.

‚Ä¢ As I mentioned above, the machine acts like it's finished before the full shot has been produced. Not only does any espresso stop dripping out into the carafe, but the machine belches out a fair amount of steam, which I always thought was a sign it was done. But no, if you just wait patiently the machine starts up again (it takes about 20 seconds, so it's REALLY tempting to give up) and eventually produces a full shot.

review_content: I have to start out by saying that this coffee maker does its work. It does make the expresso quick and effectively. However, im rating it 2 stars because the machine has a VERY STRONG smell coming from the material inside the water reservoir. It is extremely strong. I cleaned it just as instructed in manual, a couple of time. Also made a couple of expressos. The water and the expresso come out with the strong smell. I dont know what to do next.
title: Strong Smell
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
two years later: Over time, the unit has held up very well. It works great with coconut milk, which I learned to like. I just heat up creamer in microwave while espresso is being made. Works well in tandem. I clean the tubes according to instructions, about once a week. I also hand wipe the espresso area maybe every two weeks.

I decided customer service is pretty good. But if something does go wrong under warrantee of 1 year, they will send new one. After that, you're on your own. Overall, it is a great price point. There is no other product in its class for anywhere near the price you pay for this unit.

It is great design, easy to set up and use and clean up. I just learned it will not work right with half and half; it is too thick. must be milk or soy milk, etc. If you are allergic to milk like me, take note. I guess the unit does not build enough pressure to force the steam through it and make it flow through the unit's tubing very effectively.
My first unit started leaking steam somewhere after 3 months. Customer Service has NO technical support, they just send a new unit and may or may not want the old unit back. It took about three weeks for the second unit to arrive. They get two stars for Customer service, though they were good about replacing the unit within the one year warranty period, but that is expected.

It leaked steam the first time I used the new unit, until I switched to milk. I use filtered water in the reservoir so less de-liming is required. If you are in hard water country, think about using bottled water or get a water softener or an under-sink reverse osmosis unit.

Bottom line: I have to use this unit with milk for some time to determine quality of unit itself.
title: Unit must not use half and half or cream, only milk or other thinner liquids
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content:
This machine is so easy, yet makes the best coffee outside a professional machine in a restaurant! If =I= can do this without screwing up, anyone can.
Well - I did screw up! Once I let the water run out - and wondered why my cappucino was so dang weak. (all froth and no coffee makes lousy drink.) I also got a really great burr grinder - auto of course. (KRUPS GX 5000) Yours truly couldn't make the thing work - to find out I'd put the beans in the WRONG place (I was, of course, grinding pure air.)
Together - when used by a non-putz like me - I tell you, the coffee is superbly rich. You get what you SMELL for once! And the Barista - all you do is load in the water, pop some milk or cream in the holder, push it into place. Put your coffee into the thingie, and press a button! It burps out hot froth - pauses a moment, and ERUPTS out a double stream of dark, rich brew.
Brings a wee tear to the eye (even if its ME using a machine like that, it might be a a tear of laughter!)
title: This machine is so easy, yet makes the best coffee outside a professional ...
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Espresso/Cappuccino Maker

review_content: Best thing ever. I have had it 6 months and made literally hundreds of drinks. I buy the torani flavors and they are great. I make the same drink that I buy at Starbucks for $6.85 for about $0.17 and it takes about 5 min to do that whole thing which I spent in line anyway. I recommend the caf√© bustelo expresso. You could get it from local supermarket like HEB for $3.00 and one can will make about 50 drinks. They sell it on here for a little more than that. The most expensive part is the flavors at $10-$14 each bottle. but if you know your combination just buy the ones you like.You can make about 30-40 drinks with one. My favorite is 2 pumps white chocolate with 3 pumps peppermint...it's like Christmas in a cup.

This product was virtually unusable. It leaked and spewed steam all over, and the carafe ended up being only 2/3 (or less) full. We tried it 5 or 6 times cranking the grounds filter as tight as possible, but no improvement. The leakage went all over the machine and the counter. Some of the leakage was brown, creating an even bigger mess. We noticed other reviews that noted the same problem.
DO NOT purchase this item, unless you are prepared to return it!!
It may be this is a "Best Seller" because people return it and reorder it thinking it was defective. One review said they had purchased FIVE of these, but had to return them all!!

review_content:
The coffee maker stopped working after the initial cleaning. The thermal switch died. Made no sense to return to Amazon as I live overseas and the original cost to ship to me was nearly the price of the unit. To return and receive a replacement would have resulted in the unit costing me approx. 3 - 4 times the cost. I therefore "bit the bullet" and absorbed the loss.
I cannot blame Amazon though as I know they would have replaced it without hassle. C'est la vie.
June 25th 2011 - Update - Try as I may I could not source a replacement thermal switch. I decided to do something radical. I removed the thermal switch, heated it over my stove element and tested for continuity with my ohmmeter. I got a reading but it was not within expectations. I kept reheating and cooling until my reading reached zero. I reinstalled it and it is now working beautifully. Maybe it needed a little "heat" in it's butt to work.
title: Non-functional Coffee Maker
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content: Ordered product after much searching, reviewing, determining needs, etc. The order process went well, as usual, the machine arrived quickly, & of course I immediately had to start playing with it. This machine makes very good espresso, nice, dark, rich with crema, very tasty. I also had a chance to use the frother for some wonderfully good cappucinos. Once you prime the pump before first use, it is ready to go from then on. Of course, the quality of your espresso will definitely be determined by the quality of the water you use, along with the quality & freshness of the beans - tap water is a no-no; filtered water is good, but your favorite bottled water will make the best drink if used with your favorite fresh beans that are ground for immediate use. All in all, I have to say, Mr. Coffee always made good coffee makers, but unless you can afford to spend hundred$ of dollar$ on a fine Italian espresso machine (I couldn't), this is as good as "inexpensive" gets.
title: Very nice drinks, easy to use, excellent value
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content: I have been using Mr. Coffee espresso machines for over 20 years.  I find that they generally wear out after about 5 years with a lot of use.  But, my latest purchase was almost the same price as the first one I bought so many years ago, so I don't mind replacing them.  Especially since it makes great espresso.  My favorite is an iced mocha which I have almost daily.  It is definitely as good as the expensive drinks from the coffee houses.  I could not be without my Mr. Coffee.
title: Makes great espresso
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
At this price point, I think that this machine has easily paid for itself. I love my Mocha in the morning (especially when winter comes around), and I was not happy when my previous espresso machine died (especially since it was a high quality machine). I bought this one as something to tide me over until I got around to buying a better one, but I now suspect that this will last me for some time.

This makes a good espresso, and it is super easy to use. Having the one switch that converts between espresso and steamer functionality makes it nice and easy. The beaker to hold the espresso means you don't have to try and line up espresso shot glasses, and the markings on the beaker make it easy to see how much you are getting.

On the negative side of things, this is a case where you get what you pay for - at the cheap price, do not expect the moon.

There is no crema evident, however if you are making a Latte or a Mocha or ... do you really care? I am grinding my beans fresh before making the espresso, and using a fine grain, with a medium tamp down. So I would have expected at least a little crema.

The beaker has a marking at the equivalent of a double shot, however it is not marked as that. Twice that marking is marked as 2 cups, and the next marking is 4 cups. However if you do make that much coffee, expect it to be fairly diluted - to be fair, I would expect any espresso machine to make diluted coffee if you make 8 shots from a single basket of ground coffee. The beaker also contains a lid that makes it easy to center the beaker below the nozzle, however I am not sure that this is needed. The lid (if put on correctly) results in the coffee markings being off-center. Hardly a big deal.

This machine does not have a water reservoir, and I have mixed feelings about this. My (far more) expensive machine had one, and that meant I would only fill up with filtered water once a week, or could fill up on the fly if we drank more coffee than normal. However this machine requires a refill of water each brew, and it is important to ensure that the pressure has been released before taking the cap off totally - fortunately the cap seems to have been designed so that it starts releasing pressure long before you could possibly get the cap off.

While I have put everything through the dishwasher, the shiny metallic sheen on the holder for the coffee basket is paint on top of a not-so-shiny metal, and that paint does not survive the dishwasher. Do not expect it to be shiny afterwards. :-)

While it seems that I have posted a fair few negative comments, every single one of them is extremely minor nit-picking. At the end of the day, it is the espresso itself that matters, and this makes a good brew.
title: Good machine for the price
bought_model: Color: CappuccinoStyle Name: 4-Cup Steam

review_content:
Look, if you're the type of person who will be bothered by not having a stainless steel grinds tamper, do yourself a favor and buy a more expensive European machine. You'll be happier in the end. But if you don't care about aesthetics, then this is an excellent little espresso machine. I can't speak to longevity, as I've only had it about two months, but in that time I've used the machine almost daily and never had a problem. I can't even see the pressure dropping off although it's probably about time to do a cleaning. I've been using distilled water which is supposed to let you go longer between running a vinegar solution through. Milk steamer works great, though I haven't used it that often. Perfect crema.

All in all, given the relative lower price of the Mr. Coffee, this has been a great purchase. Much better than a steam-based system and the coffee tastes great.

UPDATE: I am taking two stars off my original review as this machine seems to have problems over time. After about six months, we got the blinking green lights of death, even though there was no blockage or other obvious mechanical problem. Warranty was honored and the manufacturer sent a new unit. That one lasted less than eight months before it too died with the mysterious blinking lights. So while both machines were good while they lasted, the didn't last, and I would have been better off buying something more reliable.
title: Great machine for the price -- but not for the long haul
bought_model: Color: SilverStyle Name: Automatic Dual Shot

review_content:
Excellent, highly recommend! Many other espresso and latte machines don't come with a built in milk reservoir. This is like the ONLY one on the market. Store your milk right in the machine and then when you are done stick it in the fridge. No longer do you have to measure the amount of milk you want for cappucino or latte, then stick it in a separate cup to froth. One button and it does it for you!

You can also customize how much espresso/milk you want if you don't like the default portions. Come with single and double shot attachments. Quick, easy, and works phenomenal.
title: The only espresso maker you should ever own

review_content: I've been contemplating purchasing an espresso machine for several years now, but had always been under the impression that you had to spend big money to get one that was worth having around.  Boy, was I wrong!  This machine has been fantastic!  Makes great espresso, and the milk frother is an added bonus.  Easy to use, easy to clean.  Prior to this purchase, I had never made espresso before, so there was a bit of a learning curve before my espresso was worth drinking, but now that I've got the hang of it I will never go back to a regular drip coffee maker.  I only wish I hadn't waited so long to make the purchase!

title: It was simple and excellent. Bought the same system in 2014

review_content:
I purchased this unit about a week ago and I decided to write a review that targets a very specific audience.

If you really enjoy Espresso, Cappuccino or even a Latte and you don't like having to pay the high cost of purchasing them from your local coffee shop...AND if you don't have a lot of money to invest in equipment...then this review was written for you.

For the money...you will not find a better Espresso machine out there. This is by far the best value on the market as of today (12/2012).
I started off with an Aeropress and a hand powered burr grinder from Kyocera that made a very very good substitute for Espresso. And my wife and I were very happy with that system. But we found that the time involved kept us from enjoying our morning Espresso as often as we would have liked and I ended up going out pretty often to a local shop when I felt the need.

So I began reading reviews online, watching youtube videos and talking to folks to see what my options were. I was pretty pleased to find out that I did have an affordable option available to me..and so I took the plunge.

From Amazon I purchased a Baratza Encore grinder ($130), Mr. Coffee ECMP50 ($80), and an Espresso Tamper. I already had an Aerolatte milk frother (Highly recommended).

The combination of this equipment produces an outstanding result that is better than a lot of local shops in my area...and probably yours too! If you can afford to spend $250 then THIS is the way to go...and I can assure you that you will not be disappointed in the result.

Go out to a local coffee roaster and get a recommended Espresso blend whole bean (FRESH is BEST). Grind it in the Baratza Encore at the 9 setting for the Mr. Coffee ECMP50 and follow the directions to produce the Espresso. Pour milk into your coffee cup and get it hot in the microwave....then use the Aerolatte milk frother to almost double it in volume. Add your flavorings and sweetener as desired and then pour the Expresso into it to enjoy a WONDERFUL treat.

Now think about it...if you just spend $4 per drink and buy just 2 per week (1 for you and 1 for your wife) you will spend $416 per year. With the system above you can produce two drinks EVERY DAY for less than $600 for the YEAR (INCLUDING THE COST OF COFFEE BEANS and MILK!) And even if you have to replace the Mr. Coffee every year....you still come out on top of the deal!
So you get 7X the coffee at just a little bit more cost than going to a local shop for just 1 per week. How can you beat that deal?

Having said all this I again HIGHLY RECOMMEND this system for those who can spend $250 on their equipment and who love Espresso/Cappuccino/Latte drinks. You will NOT be disappointed, I promise you. Life is too short to not enjoy a good Espresso/Cappuccino/Latte...and the economy is too bad to go to your local shop on a regular basis. So make the plunge now and give YOURSELF a present that you will enjoy for years to come.

*** 1 Month update ****
Everything is still going strong and I have had ZERO problems. The one thing that I now realize is that I should have taken into account the cost associated with cleaning the grinder and Espresso Maker. There are a few options that you can run through your grinder to clean the parts that are not designed to be easily removed for cleaning...but I have not chosen one for recommendation yet. Once I do, I will refactor the the costs shown above and amend them. The cost of cleaning the Espresso machine can be mitigated by using quality water and following the cleaning recommendations in the manual.
I do not expect for the additional cost of cleaning to significantly reduce the value....but it is something that should be taken into consideration, as proper cleaning will increase the life span of your equipment and therefore reduce the cost per serving over the performance period.

*** 10 Month update ***
Well, we have been using this machine for almost a year now and it is going strong. I just cleaned it for the first time to get ready for the fall, when our latte drinking increases.
I still highly recommend this machine if you are looking for something in the sub $300 range. Save your money for a good grinder and go with this machine. Quality ingredients, good water, and investing in a good grinder and you are all set to save big $$ while making drinks better than you can buy at Starbucks!

**** 32 Month update ****
This machine is still are big part of our family routine...and is going strong. I have heard of folks who have had issues with this machine, but can attest that mine is still working great. Again, maintenance is a big part of ensuring that the system operates trouble free. AND, using good quality water. It is easier to NOT gum up the machine, than to have to descale it constantly!

While this has been a staple in my home, I am now making the plunge into a more expensive espresso maker. Having gone from prepping for 1 - 2 frequently during the week to 3 every single day, I feel that I can justify the expense of a step up machine that is designed to take that kind of production. But I will always remember this machine, like a first love, it go me though my initial exploration into the wonderful world of espresso. Thank You Mr. Coffee!
